6Itp9bPCtjYURuOzZB4S6w.text: Went here for dinner on a Sunday evening, as the "fancier restaurant" at the resort was close. DId I mention I had 4 starving teenage boys with me? What a pleasant surprise this restaurant was, the food was great and our server, Lisa Tussing, who is studying to get her sommelier's designation was a big part of the reason the meal was so enjoyable. I had the surf and turf and one of my son's had the ribs with mac and cheese. Everyone enjoyed their meal, the presentation was great and the wine pairings that Lisa suggested were fabulous. We enjoyed this restaurant so much, we came back on Monday evening, even though the "fancier restaurant" was also open. I suggest the s'mores for dessert, although the creme brulee and the warm apple cobbler with ice cream was delicious too. Will definitely come back to this restaurant.

IuxP7siy0SAkDYvSFnHvjg.text: I have had a great experience every time I have been there.  The food is hard to beat and the service was pleasant.    Portions are reasonable, not huge (I'm a big feller), and I was satified every time I ate there.    Very pleasant environment, clean, spacious and calm.

HlLR8w5EEhwwi7Qx4x9tCw.text: The food was okay - not great, but okay.  I guess if you are interested in Frank Lloyd Wright architecture and staying at the Biltmore, its worth a visit, but not necessarily worth a special trip.  Fries poached in duck fat - very good, very well done Grass fed sliders/hamburger - meat was good, bun was a little hard Pizza - was actually quite tasty but not New Haven pizza - I think there is too much fat in the crust.  But even though it isn't authentic, it is nonetheless tasty. Broccoli rabe - tasty, but a tad over cooked, a bit mushy Angel hair pasta with olives - WAAAY too many olives. I love olives and this one was just overkill. Also, how is it that restaurants can make their pasta al dente?  pasta was overcooked. Chicken and goat cheese flat bread - very good the figs and argula made it a very tasty and relatively healthy option "famous" meatloaf - meh, but then again I have never been wowed by meatloa Short ribs - okay, not great. Salmon - It first came out too dry (overcooked) we had it returned and a new one came back cold. FAIL Prime Rib - was very good, the potato was GINORMOUS  Though the Yelp review says $$, it's probably closer to $$$ - since most of the main dishes were in the $20-$30 range.  So with appetizers and drinks, the per person price was closer to $45-$50 than under $30.

xi2St0aYSaIlDV7Y0ZWB6Q.text: I took a couple of clients here today for lunch and was surprisingly underwhelmed for a restaurant located in such an established and beautiful hotel.   Service was adequate but the food was overpriced and just not that good.  The french dip was oversalted, but otherwise flavorless; the burger, just a burger.   I eat out almost every day due to my job, and I cannot recommend this restaurant unless you are stuck at the hotel and have no other options.

EGKMHJAB1j410H90mMAUwg.text: I came here for a conference at the Biltmore and I had no car so I basically lived at this restaurant. The service was always impeccable and the food was delicious.    I ate here three times a day for two days and never got bored with the menu. They are accommodating for food allergies and split a meal onto two plates if you are sharing. The food presentation is also always well done which is an added bonus.

td7uS4wl60YNxysaPCwEVg.text: Let's see ... The restaurant is great & the famous architecture is a nice touch for the scenery. The food is very average. Caesar salad was covered with too much dressing and the sea bass was too well done. Coconut custard pie for dessert wasn't bad. I would still suggest coming to check out the Biltmore where Frank and Alberts is located. It's worth the trip to see this famous property.

h9-lItCEKeMZx6q8adv04g.text: for the area and the price of each item I expected a lot more. this was a second choice for me because the Wright Restaurant didn't open until after 5, i ordered the short rib mac and cheese and it was nothing less then short, there was no taste to it at all, i had to add hot sauce just to get flavor an di am not even a fan of hot sauce,  i would say to avoid this joint, Denny's would be better

qMb0BK9LwtwMyVnBSWr5KQ.text: Great happy hour deal- I got a martini for $5, and ordered from their savory bites appetizer menu (4 for $5) and got a whole bunch of food.  It's not a ton, but plenty to fill me up.  If you're starving, order a couple more regular sized appetizers for $5 each.  In any case, I was a happy camper when total bill came out to under $11.

AL7BOz2FsfjCo5unjtJmUw.text: The place was not busy when our party of six arrived.  The physical setting is clean and kind of high tech.  The waiter was better than okay but not great.  The food was disappointing for the price.   The hotel is excellent.  The food was less than average.    They use too much salt in their cooking for my taste.  The meatloaf reads interesting and was recommended by a bar tender - don't do that.  Three of the party had prime rib and said it was as good as the "Saturday night special" any place in the country except the potatoes were undercooked.     Overall, it was a okay meal at pretty upscale price.  I like the hotel but I will not eat that this restaurant again.

1Nd1V1wcE-QbG5G4CoBOcw.text: I guess it's not really the most accessible place, but Frank & Albert's is located in the Arizona Biltmore Resort & Spa and serves as one of their restaurants to their guests.  Since the other breakfast place they had was only a cafe that served baked goods, I decided to come here to have a proper breakfast.  When I asked what they recommended they immediately said "the Biltmore Benedict".  I was easily sold so I ordered one, and a coffee.  Cool thing about the coffee is they just bring you a carafe to serve yourself coffee as you please.  Not sure if this was because the waitress was lazy, but I thought it was nice.  The eggs benedict themselves were not the best.  On one hand the ham that they used was overcooked (ie. jerky).  On the other hand the english muffin was over toasted and too crispy, which kinda ruined the overall consistency.  It is a nice patio that they have to sit on, so I will give them that.  They apparently have a bird problem where birds kinda come and scavenge for food.  I didn't really mind it.

3wfVc817l-D04L6-DUSsLQ.text: Stephanie was my server, she brought me the best french toast ever! Creme brulee french toast is amazing.  I came back for dinner and I had the salmon and it was also amazing.  Gabino was my server for dinner, he was ok. Check this place out!

0YoXZH2Va2_SKhiQ4K0FpA.text: My in-law's were staying at the Biltmore for the weekend, so we checked out Frank and Albert's for dinner on Sunday night.  The prices are pretty steep, but it's within a resort so you have to expect your meatloaf dinner to be over $20. We sampled many different dishes such as the turkey meatloaf with mashed potatoes and mixed veggies within the potatoes, empanadas, pizza and the yummy and not too greasy hamburger served on an English muffin. I found the food to be very good, but a bit pricey.  Our server Alexis was awesome! She was so friendly and made sure we had everything we needed.  I didn't get to try any of their desserts, but everything on the dessert menu sounded delicious.  Despite the high prices I would go back.

d7GKAISdXIfZr9hKGeADfg.text: This place is primarily for hotel guests without transportation, and the food, unfortunately, is mediocre at best. Such potential too, great service, a gorgeous space, but the menu choices are lacking imagination although the presentation is excellent. But I go to a restaurant for the FOOD, and even their "signature meatloaf" was over-cooked and dry, the brisket "special" was very tough and thick and very fatty and also over-cooked. We had the chicken meatball appetizer which was the best thing we had, and the desserts were also excellent. Too bad the chef-de-cuisine doesn't know how to cook meat. A great place if you're stuck at a hotel, but there are MUCH better places close-by in the Biltmore fashion park.

BgnwrnPZ_rY0ZTY7jrQNXA.text: Just didn't do it for me. The food was bland and overpriced. I had a better meal at the Cheesecake Factory at the Biltmore Fashion Park.

csi1evsm_3If0SCrMRB_Rg.text: I'm sorry, but this place is a total ripoff for lunch.  If not for people using their corporate Amex cards while being stranded on the island, this place would have no chance.  This cheeseburger and fries combo is not worth $15.  It just isn't.  And the service doesn't warrant the markup, either.

o63yPBJqTmtGsfvZmDdyqA.text: My coolest gal pals and I celebrated my birthday at Frank & Albert's at the Arizona Biltmore Resort.  We went during happy hour to take advantage of their lower pricing.  Unbelievable time all of us had!!  There was enough of us in attendance that we were able to try everything on the HH menu.  The food, the drinks, the service was beyond belief.  It truly lives up to the name and reputation of The Arizona Biltmore.  Of course, we shall go again and again.

lfK6IxDeW_iEHOhfbSninA.text: Had the Buffalo BLT sandwich. The sandwich came without the blue cheese mentioned on the menu and I wasn't given any silverware before my sandwich came out. (I sat at the bar). For $17 per sandwich I expect ALOT more than what I was given. Save your money.

EQP5QN6HLLidJ4U2Cxmy5g.text: My wife and I went here for happy hour last night.  If you stick to the happy hour menu then its a pretty good deal.  I should have listened to my own advice because after having a way-too-sweet happy hour Prickly Peartini I decided I needed a "big boy" drink and ordered a regular martini.  While the regular martini was decent, I should have stuck to the Prickly because $17 was outrageous for the size they give you.  My wife made the same mistake and ordered a $15 glass of wine instead of their "house" wine which would have been $5.  Needless to say we learned our lesson when it comes to drinks at this place.  We were a bit smarter about the food.  We shared a "Savory Nibbles" platter which is a selection of 4 very small....nibbles.  We shared the deviled egg, meatloaf slider, grilled cheese and the shrimp and manchego flat.  It was all excellent and I could have eaten an entire plate full of any one of those things.  Be warned that they are only a very small taste and only enough for one bite each if you are sharing with another person.  Anyway its not bad for $5 during happy hour.  There are 3 or so other selections that looked good as well.  3 or so of their other appetizers are 1/2 off during happy hour so we ordered the Charred Chicken Lollipops.  You get a decent portion of small chicken drumstick things in some tasty sauce.  They are NOT fried and weren't drowned in sauce.  Anyway, these were excellent and I would definitely order them again.   Like most decent happy hours in the valley, this one was quite typical in terms of service.  The bar area gets a bit crowded and it takes forever to get a drink and food.  It is not really the waiters' fault because they are going almost as fast as they can.  The problem is that there aren't enough of them so they are stuck serving way to many tables.

48EtZ-2lkvi0M9KjCDgBoA.text: The best food here is the appetizers. The meals aren't very good but if you go with a bunch of friends and order appetizers and drinks then you will have a fun time. Maybe step outside and play a game of chess on the giant chess board or checkers if you  don't know how to play chess.

LCOkAmcLQsYBlWEBDf3OcQ.text: Frank & Albert's is probobly one of my favorite restaurants in town. The menu is creative and the ingredients are very fresh - its just good, unpretentious comfort food made and served in the best way possible. The home-made ketchup and mustard are excellent additions to the delicious onion rings and duck fat fries. The drinks are also innovative.

yho0RBL_qiss6y5McF_URQ.text: This place deserves even more than 5 stars!!!  My fiance and me stayed at Biltmore resort in Phoenix for a week. We decided to get all inclusive, so we could relax at this beautiful place and have our meals there, in stead of driving around trying to find new places every day in the city. And OMG we are so happy we did it!!! The food was amazing. We both LOVED every single meal we had there and were super happy with their great service!!! Everyone working there was so nice and friendly, but our favorite was Sherri. That lady deserves all the 5 stars too  I don't even know where to start with my food reccommendations, but if you are there for breakfast, you gotta try their french toast. It was heaven...  I highly reccomend this place to everyone. You won't be dissapointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mascarpone pancakes. Delicious!
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast. Heaven!!!

YuKPHdyDiGE8cPPr47WdOQ.text: We enjoyed a casual dinner on the patio with great wine, excellent service and unique menu of tasty food.   The scallops were really good and so was the chicken Parmesan.  We also liked the personal attention provided by our waiter.  He did not rush us and shared some interesting facts about the hotel.  If you are visiting the Biltmore I would highly recommend enjoying dinner here.

F4KvmGM_PdGrA7yc6ZZ-SQ.text: Really delicious chicken sandwich and best crispiest fries I have ever tasted. My companion enjoyed his hamburger and with one cocktail and tip our lunch came to $60 so not cheap but it was so delicious and a great ambience. We will go back. Friendly service too.

gf0htpmu9LPE4MaeehZ4Rw.text: Nice ambiance.....walk through the bar area to the the dining room, open kitchen, fairly loud.....expediter had a booming voice.  Started with a shared Waldorf Salad.....tangy dressing was like a vinaigrette mixed with yogurt.  Pretty good.  Crisped bits of bacon were tasty, but there were CHUNKS of bacon fat in the mix, which I used to gross out my wife.  That was not good.  Otherwise, just order the salad and ask them to keep out the bacon fat chunks.  She had pan roasted salmon, not her favorite way to have it cooked, but she tried to keep an open mind.  At the end, she felt it was just "ok".  I had the short rib.  It was overall the most disappointing short rib ever.  Beautiful and deliciously creamy polenta with corn salsa was amazingly tasty, but the rib was like a big piece of stew beef.    It broke apart in strings, like pre-pulled pork.  A great short rib should be tender, flavorful, juicy and supple....this was chewy-chewy.  Supposedly it was rubbed with mole, but I couldn't taste it.  Not bad enough to send back, but not good enough to order again.  We shared the butterscotch pudding, and that was one of the best restaurant desserts we have had.  Try it!  With drinks and tip, the bill was $129.11

dHjUCZaWKKpSN7i9X7fEaw.text: I was staying at this hotel for a conference, and the first day i ate both lunch and dinner here, and the last day I ate lunch.  First up, lunch: quesadilla was full of BBQ sauce (like completely smothered). It was called a bbq chicken quesadilla, but i thought it just meant that the chicken was barbecued, and sauce would be on the side. Not so. It was okay, but not great. Iced tea was just so-so, and at $4.00, the drinks should be spectacular. There's no reason a fountain drink should cost that much, ever. Even if the tea was brewed, this is tea, after all. Not like it was brewed with water that someone had to trek and get from the melting ice caps.  Sunday dinner: had the "famous" tortilla soup. Good, but nothing I would call famous.   Last lunch/dinner: tried the buttermilk chicken bites, which were much smaller than I expected, but the breading was nice and crispy, and the sauce wasn't too much. I could have easily gotten something else to go along with it, but had to head to the airport. I liked this much more than the quesadilla.  Prices were reasonable.

tcV3ox1oygTb6lcXeaUANg.text: Came here for Easter breakfast buffet and wanted an option that wouldn't give me as much sticker shock like the Easter brunch at Wright's on property which was $100+/adult and $40/kid vs. $28/adult at Frank & Albert's. That being said, I get it....it IS the Arizona Biltmore so you are expected to unload a lot of money here as it is a five star resort. We were guests for the Biltmore's Easter activities and our children enjoyed an egg hunt, in addition to an adorable carnival. We had an 11:15am reservation to Frank & Albert's which I had booked almost 3 weeks in advance. I assumed it would probably be packed. After all the Easter festivities, we got to the restaurant 10 minutes early. I checked in with the hostess to see if we could be seated earlier than our reservation time. I glanced around at the restaurant and it was half empty. I was told no, and to return at 11:15am. No biggie, as my kids enjoyed playing chess outside at the nearby outdoor chessboard. At 11:15 we returned and were finally seated at a booth with two sets of silverware tucked inside a rolled up napkin.  Sherry was our server and she was very pleasant. Our kids opted to order off the menu, whereas my husband and I had the breakfast buffet, which has a nice variety of warm breakfast foods, an omelet station, cured meats and cheese platter, fresh fruit, pastry basket variety (our faves were the mini chocolate croissant), yogurt and oatmeal. It was plenty filling for all of us. Though Sherry was kind to bring out our food and refill our drinks, we had to fend for ourselves to get three additional napkins and silverware for our family. After we were finished eating, it took quite awhile to flag our server so we could get the check to pay our bill. We weren't quite sure what caused such a delay considering the fact it wasn't busy (by the time we left, the restaurant was still half empty). Maybe it was a fluke, or maybe we should have come for dinner time on another day, but the food was just OK, and nothing I'd consider noteworthy or outstanding. For a restaurant on property at a resort of this caliber, I had higher expectations of the food quality and service.

JD34wVx_6Iqc_5F3fj8TWA.text: Amazing!!! Love the foods and servers was friendly... will come back and stay at Az biltmore again

Q1dWdU1Gm5u2iRBa_sO73g.text: Great food and service!  The soup and salad (southwestern chicken salad) is a delicious meal for those not seeking to indulge on heavier items.  Located at the Biltmore Resort, this restaurant has it all.  You won't be disappointed.

75RmVnT0fiH91z6Nxh7moA.text: I've eaten here twice and both times had the most amazing salad-- the A&H, which is a cabbage slaw with BBQ chicken and nuts. It's just the right combinations of sweet and crunchy and still light. My husband had the Caesar with Shrimp and no croutons (he's on Atkins) and to his delight they have fried Parmesan crisps so he could still get some crunch without breaking his diet. Sit out on the indoor patio which lets you have both the sun and the AC!

-mL41rsKFdFI54T2EeM5mA.text: 1 stars because of the service. I ordered the chicken and the inside was raw! The guac was old and fries were soggy. For a 5 star hotel the quality of the food was nothing short of a disgrace! I only hope I don't get salmonella poisoning. Frank Lloyd Wright would not be happy if he was still around !

JGiPqP24mFyeZiIBS_-SwA.text: We sat down and it took 15 minutes for a waiter to notice us. We ordered and after 30 minutes we got up and left. Terrible, Terrible service

HPEEUdh90gu_YL6BWtcTZQ.text: For a "free" breakfast (came with my $500 dollar room so not so free)... Total shit.  The Hyatt House in Scottsdale where I once paid $90 had a far superior buffet.  If you love soggy bacon this is for you!  Can't they leave the lid up on their steel bacon holding containers so the moisture doesn't accumulate? Duh.  Like the hotel it is located in, nice scenery doesn't cut it.   Horrible food. Even the sausage patties were similar to compacted shart.

H1sWLybXRpBQqg8tadhqww.text: Immerse yourself in a setting inspired by Mr.Frank Lloyd Wright himself and savor some of the better Southwestern infused upscale comfort food this side of anything offered at Kai.  It truly captures the essence of its famous namesake.

gzpbgI_r9cGL30gieJGp8Q.text: We ate here twice during our stay at the Biltmore.  Breakfast is probably the best thing they do.  Our breakfast was wonderful.  I had a sort of southwest inspired Benedict (without the ham) and the corn 'cake' underneath was to die for and laced with chilis.  We were given a large pot of decaf which was wonderfully brewed.  Our roasted breakfast potatoes were actually "roasted to perfection."  (It's funny how so many menus will say something is prepared "to perfection" and how little it's actually True, but it was True here and they didn't actually say it on the menu.)  We also enjoyed our server who was entertaining, friendly and accommodating.  Switch over to evening and our 2nd meal at F&A's - dinner.  The food was decent but not spectacular.  I'm pretty sure the Ceasar salad had MSG in the dressing because I only had two bites of my boyfriend's salad and within a few minutes I was well into an MSG reaction.  So, docking a star for that.  The roasted winter vegetables were sublime.  I'd never really enjoyed parsnips before, but these ones rocked.  If you don't feel like leaving "campus" Frank & Albert's will do you right.  (Just watch out for the MSG.)

xO5NMqv70U6HTsoszoMgcw.text: Food: 4.5 Decor: 5 Ambiance: 5 Service: 4 Value: 5  An absolute must-visit for FLW fans. Great happy hour deals and actual quality food/drinks.

vQQ1amX9R-6Zcil2E3ev4A.text: This place is great if you are staying at the Arizona Biltmore. It's not too fancy, but the food is high quality. They told me that their meatloaf was their "specialty item", so I decided to give it a try. It was amazing! I would definitely return to this place if I'm ever staying at the hotel.

z6Y0UFz28GHT-jzgSQyhoQ.text: This is a favorite place to go for A Thanksgiving holiday brunch. The food does not disappoint.. My favorite was the first course selection of roasted Brussel salad. I had melt to your mouth filet mignon and a some very moist and tasty turkey. The green beans with mushrooms were seasoned perfectly, as well as the mashed and sweet potatoes. The dessert selection was abundant and delicious.  We were greeted by very friendly staff as soon as we walked in. Our server, Emmerrel (may have spelling wrong) was very attentive, quick and friendly. He conveyed a genuine interest in providing excellent service. This is a tradition that will continue, without a doubt. I love the holiday decor inside and out.

Sn0LEm0cg8Fkl6iv23T7EQ.text: I honestly cannot understand how some restaurants can feel good about being open.   Today I took my family to Frank & Alberts for my dads 77th birthday.     We have small children, 8 and 6, so we ordered wine for us and their food.   40 minutes later the Food was brought out.   The Wien came about 20 minutes after that.     In truth, the food was fine but took forever.    The server was in the weeds and to management's discredit, he was left to his own devices to try and get caught up.     Since I am here for a week, probably have to try again but not looking forward to it.

v-RSQIGIjOOoUC5yTgpGtw.text: Overpriced.... but you are at the AZ Biltmore, so you had better plan on that.  The service is great, the food is good and the establishment is awesome, especially when you consider how old it is.  I will be back!!!

iYgEqnfKKybmCpS0SaXm_A.text: I came here for dinner before an event at the Biltmore. We split a few dishes. My absolute favorite was the caprese salad. It had heirloom tomatoes, balsamic vinegar, watercress, celery leaves, and burrata cheese. Burrata cheese can be hard to find friending in eegee's you live, so this was a treat. The pizza and chicken tenders were very good. The chicken tenders were most and flavorful. The service was ok. We were forgotten about after asking for a take home box. If you have a chance, give Frank and Albert's a visit!

VZx15SmR-7mF62E_ZaTMNQ.text: My bride and I love the Biltmore and certain are huge fans of all of the culinary delights offered there. As it's located on one of the area's oldest and famous resorts, stick around and take a stroll through the hotel and the grounds.

Huf08sRZ-q293w6OwqSo9Q.text: Came to the Biltmore for a family Staycation. Took them to F&A on our first night. We were fortunate enough to get Zach as our server (I'd had him on a previous trip out here). Wonderful service, very attentive and a charmer as well. Lots of ma'am and sirs to my hubby and I, young miss and the young gentlemen to our teenage kids. Pampered! Drinks came quickly, water and sodas refilled often.  The food! My daughter and I split the ribeye with potato gratin. To die for, we were both in heaven! Sauce for the steak was on point, asparagus good but could have used a better trim and a touch of lemon, but that gratin is amazing. Seriously a potato and cream taken to perfection! Hubby had the cheeseburger and fries. He wasn't feeling fancy. But a d@mn decent burger with really good fries. My son was the lucky winner though, with meatloaf of all things! It had to have been 8-10 oz of meatloaf over potato puree, topped with house made chipotle ketchup and fried onion strings. He had the temerity to tell ME! Me! It was better than mine! I made him give me a bite. He wasn't wrong. He wouldn't give me another bite. Jerk! I would have reconsidered my choice of ribeye if not for those potatoes gratin.  I'm looking forward to the next few nights to explore the rest of the menu. Looking forward to the porkchop or filet mignon. Saw and smelled them as they passed. Very promising!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The ribeye that I SPLIT with my daughter. Yeah. This was MY half!

M0Iq0u0q7KryyfKcWPkIvA.text: I ate at Frank & Albert's twice while staying at the Arizona Biltmore Hotel. Both times, the food was decent but the service was horrible. I tried a few different salads, a few pizzas, and a few appetizers.   The first time I dined here, we sat outside by the fireplace which was lovely. The weather was perfect and the company was great too. The second time I came here, we sat inside but the problem was that they only had 1 server on duty that night inside. It was so slow!!!!   For being one of two restaurants in a very prestigious hotel, they really should consider hiring more staff.

BSD4RmJ1t3YhNIYaimpz9A.text: Fabulous breakfast here on Sunday morning;  blazing fires, open patios, absolutely love the ambiance here in the Arizona sunshine.   Both my husband and I had eggs/bacon dishes- hubby said the hash browns are "to die for", so don't miss these.  Service was friendly and efficient and our breakfast arrived in just minutes.  Coffee was kept full and we were quite happy with our experience.  It's on the Biltmore property, so expect to pay a little more, ~$45 for two.  Worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs, bacon and fruit..   Great start to the day :)

ht7HwICKVo1BxQyJwvL8yw.text: The atmosphere is great but the food is pricey and it is a little more than OK but not great. They do have happy hour drinks but not on all food items. We came here mainly to see the architecture of Frank Lloyd Wright.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Capresse salad

xrus1VffBujew33RBfmfOw.text: Had both dinner and breakfast here. The dinner was beyond what we expected. Very tasty pork tenderloin and an above average pizza.  Breakfast tacos were real good and filling. If you are staying at the Biltmore and looking for a meal, this is a really solid option.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chasing Manhattan
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar

E8Ww0BKp0eK-tDEVNw7hsQ.text: Enjoyed a sumptuous dinner here with two companions. The service was impeccable and our appetizers, entrees and desserts were delicious. Adding to this culinary delight was a superb bottle of wine from a local Arizona vineyard.   Kudos to Frank & Albert's and the Arizona Biltmore Resort, a Waldorf Astoria fine resort.   This hotel holds a special place in my heart. I'm not biased, I'm enthralled at her beauty.

dmV-PPmk-ZVXlxRHqMSr2A.text: The F&A salad was awful. I expected a salad bursting with southern flavors,  maybe a chipotle taste. Instead it was cabbage drenched in mayo and BBQ sauce with cinnamon coated cashews. Who comes up with these terrible combinations. On the other hand the staff was amazing. Very helpful and will go above and beyond to accomodate you. They only need a different chef or different menu.

8J2-in0XaAECUjCz_QATXg.text: The staff in this restaurant are some of the most unwelcoming, unfriendly and generally unhappy bunch I think I've ever seen in one place. There must be something stemming from management as it was truly remarkable. This is part of the Biltmore Hotel and was my first experience here. What a turn off. I was going to have a multi course meal, it left after a drink and app. Won't return.

xr8M2ZsZQGWv1SthyuG6pQ.text: Over priced for the food that was provided and poor service at this type of resort restaurant. Lunch for 6 of us with one drink cost over $200. Our server had to keep asking what kind of drink we wanted numerous times!  Our group started off with the cilantro hummus, which was extremely light and didn't taste like hummus. To be honest, it was more like baby food. To the main meal, I had ordered the special which was fry bread with cilantro chicken, beans, tomato, guacamole and sour cream - almost a taco (average). Everyone else had ordered a burger, which deemed the better option (better than average).  Location of this place is pretty in the Arizona Biltmore but wish it made more of a food impact on me rather than architecturally. Love Frank Lloyd Wright!!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fry bread taco

O5FdMHBF7RwOC-S4TQdkKg.text: This place is hit or miss.  Not bad for a hotel restaurant but expensive for what you get.  I was here for a conference for a week and had to eat here about 6 times.  2 of the 6 meals were good.  The best was the pizza.  I would only eat here if you are staying here and can not get out.

LOSM63P1K6UJlZ7_ELbZzw.text: Slow, disinterested service. The Italian Panini was tasty,, the fries were pretty normal. Unremarkable . The brussels sprouts and cauliflower salad had several issues. The brussels sprouts were shredded but not wilted, so they didn't accept the vinaigrette - which was tasty but we needed to order a side of the vinaigrette because the salad was quite dry. Generally I would say the salad was not well prepared, and a little boring.

Nr0lYVbqKprC8u0aB5qfug.text: We had two amazing lunches and dinners here during a 3 day stay at The Biltmore. Everything was just perfect from service  to the food. They accommodated plant based/gluten free without a second thought; the servers and chef were very knowledgeable. The brussel sprout/cauliflower salad was exceptional!! Don't miss the table side s'mores! Everything was just fabulous.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The cauliflower salad--lovely!

-roDdmhFl8RD6fBNEHytQA.text: Revision: Upon receiving the bill, the server, Ines, chose to add $7.00 for spinach and a few baby tomatoes without my consent. I was very upset by this as I dine here several times per month and have never been upcharged like that. She further went on to suggest I was wrong when I told her I have never been upcharged for spinach and tomatoes! At least tell me before hand. She had no right to make that decision.   Needless to say this is not ok. Perhaps new management choses to encourage staff to uncharge. Not cool management.   Used to love this place. My favorite is lunch but dinner is also very very good.  I believe there is a new chef as there are a lot of new and improved dishes.   The lunch Southwest Chicken Salad is my personal favorite. I always ask for  spinach and little baby tomatoes to be added. The dressing is a very light pineapple citrus vinaigrette. (Don't be fooled by the photo, trust me, it's light).  The Sonoran Turkey Club is also excellent.  And huge! You won't leave hungry. The bread is a house made jalapeno infused bread. Not spicy at all but excellent flavor.   Tip for those doing a pool day-order from F & A first and take to the pool. Better prices and better food in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southwest Chicken Salad with 1 cup of spinach and baby tomatoes added.

Wg6emDTSlCouubLlNhxpRg.text: Ate here for the TG holiday. I always give folks a pass on the holiday, so giving it 3 stars, not 2. Not up to Waldorf snuff. Food was ok. The tortilla soup was good, but it came out 20 minutes earlier than my husband's soup.  Did the buffet for the holiday. Food was decent but was barely warm. Our waiter came by often but never cleared any plates. He kept rushing us to the buffet, trying to get us to get our mains before we got our soup, etc.  we had our menus and two courses finished with plates still on the table. He asked it he could drop the bill when my husband ordered coffee. When he brought the coffee, he told us it was the last cup and he was brewing another and he could get us to go cups with the fresh batch. The stale cup was full of coffee grounds. We were so disappointed, we just tabbed out and left since he kept hurrying us.  Was a $230 tab for fixed price meal, wine, coffee and auto-grat.  Was disappointed because it was also our anniversary. Shit meal.

pbAbLqo0OeO3cZTrfC4W9w.text: Overpriced meal options. I had the meatballs. They were burned. My mother had the meatloaf which was decent, but the sauce in top kind of ruined it. My father had the salmon and two sides. His sides were dry and looked burned. His salmon was tiny and burnt on the bottom.

dqTd4vckZAQbh4ivJ69Wkg.text: Now I know why President Obama skipped the Biltmore on his recent visit. He must have been informed about the Pork Belly and the Corned Beef from Frank and Alberts.  The atmosphere is mostly very impressive. It's very rich and airy. It's very cool Frank Lloyd Wright but with a retro diner kind of feel.  A few things about the atmosphere were not impressive. Dirty Salt and pepper shakers and crumbs on the floor. I also noticed bowls of tortilla chips just sitting out getting stale and dusty on the line the whole time we were seated.   I ordered the house made corned beef sandwich. When it arrived I thought it looked OK and took a bite. All I could taste was sauerkraut. Then I took a piece of meat out to try. It felt slimey and was very fatty. I cut off the fat and tasted the meat and it seemed corned but lacked the spices that flavor the meat. It was pretty tasteless and was just slimey and fatty. I gave a piece to my husband to try and he also said it seemed slimey to him and tasteless. I was hoping our waitress would check on us but she didn't.  I asked my husband how his Pork Belly BLT was. He said the porkbelly and roll was very dry, the bacon was good and the tomatoes were old. I didn't know how dry the porkbelly was until I got home and feed some to my dogs. It was the driest piece of meat I ever felt in my life. It was so dry that if you rubbed your skin with it you could cut yourself on it. I thought my sandwich was awful but after feeling that porkbelly I think his sandwich was worst and both sandwiches were served with cold fries.  We were NEVER checked on or asked how our meal was.  I know I should have found a manager to complain to but sometimes you just get so bummed you don't feel like it. This was suppose to be an extra special meal out at an exceptional place. These sandwiches cost about $16.00 each. Fortunately I have a Scottsdale Preferred Card and had one meal off the check but even if the meals were free they'd still be horrible.   I don't know if my exsperience is typical or not.  If you still want to give them a try after reading my review you have to do a valet park or park yourself in the garage that's around a little way from the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Unseasoned mostly just fat house made corned beef
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not so fresh tomatoes
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. F&amp;A BLT

0X18iq_YiQ68WJU7x-IG1w.text: Stopped in here while staying at the Biltmore. This is one of the lobby restaurants. It was nice easy seating. We just took a booth in the front bar area. This a pretty casual restaurant. We had the pretzel bites and the pizza. Both were very good. The pretzel bites were actually exceptional. The cheese is delectable. Would have loved to have more it only came with 4 sticks but oh well might have to go back. But this is a great restaurant if you are trying to get something simple and easy and maybe catch a game while staying at the hotel.

LzUIRRaN-HLSTj7fUtz4Mg.text: We ate here multiple times while staying at the Arizona Biltmore as part of the all-inclusive package rate they offer.  The food overall was very good!  A few of the highlights:  Smashed Avocado - Solid choice for an appetizer.  Meatloaf - This was probably our hands-down favorite item!  I never knew meatloaf could be so good!  Scottish Salmon - Very good but a bit of a small portion.  The salads - I tried several of them and they were all kind of 'meh'.  Granted it's a salad, but the actual end-result didn't quite jive with the super-yummy descriptions.  S'mores Dessert - Who doesn't love roasting marshmallows at their table! :)  Breakfast Buffet - Eh, it was ok.  There was nothing wrong with it per se, but it wasn't always kept full (sometimes the fruit bowls were empty or there was no butter out) and the selection is a little limited.  I will say the omelet station is probably the way to go here.  Service was generally fine, but certainly nothing special.  We also avoided sitting in the back sun-room (despite their attempt to seat us back there every.single.time) because it was absolutely freezing back there!  Overall a good choice if you're staying on the property!

W4AwQa-6yigitZ_-LPNmaw.text: Delicious, fresh, and great service. I recommend the turkey club and the tortilla soup, but not the artichoke dip (unless you're into sweet artichoke dips, which apparently I am not).   They may be a bit pricy but they earn it, and the atmosphere and setting were clean, plus the restaurant had the most comfortable temperature in all of the sites at the Biltmore.   You'll enjoy it, but you may have to wait. Don't worry, they'll text you when your table is ready!

wWTzzluplV6wJD8uGZ35wg.text: Thought this was a nice place to celebrate a special occasion with friends. However, very disappointed. The food was mediocre and the service was poor. We waited so long for our breakfast that our friends were done eating by the time our food arrived --- and it wasn't even hot. How long did it sit out waiting to be delivered to us?  Then, the waitress smacked an 18% grat on our bill -- for a party of two. Better of trying some of the breakfast eateries on Camelback (Snooze, Matt's Big Breakfast) that will provide better value and service!

Lfe6ADwvfAklcK1IjKbMvA.text: As the famous Biltmore brunch was not available (remodeling the dining room) this was our next runner up - at $20 the breakfast buffet was a steal for such high quality ingredients. The Bloody Mary was no slouch at $9 either.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

M08nlFC3gUzfuw4GmOU-Ug.text: So we tried this for a second time for New Years because the first year the service, food and experience was awful. This year was actually worst than last. The prime rib was awful, my guests shrimp were not cooked, service was sub par and the GM who I complained didn't really care. Save your trip and go to Hillstone or Durants.

zCfYvY1PfEEwjfzezxqh4A.text: Located inside the Biltmore, this place is an awesome restaurant to meet clients or friends for lunch.  I ordered a Margherita Pizza and some Iced Tea.  The Margarita Pizza was superb!  Very good and just the right size too....not too large & not too small.  I left satisfied.  The Iced Tea was very good too....I think I drank 5 or 6 glasses!  Of course, the service was outstanding as well.  It's no wonder why there were several tables and booths with people conducting business....it's a great place for that.  Return Factor - 96%

S6ie3XFZq99btS7lPdv0Qg.text: I had dinner at Frank and Alberts when my family came to visit and stayed at the Biltmore. Great service and a nice atmosphere. The food received mixed reviews by our table. Three people in our party ordered the caesar salad after the waiter highlighted it. Their special twish was celery, which we all assumed was mixed in for extra crunch. It turns out the entire salad is shaved celery. The celery was just way too stringy and fibrous to really enjoy, plus it watered down the flavor of the caesar dressing. Nice attempt at a twist, but I would say leave that classic alone.   On the positive side, I did really enjoy the burger - great flavor and the homemade chipotle ketchup was awesome (they also have homemade tarragon mustard). My cousin had the meatloaf which looked amazing. He's a 6'2' 16 year old athlete with a refined palate... I didn't even have a chance to ask for a bite before he devoured it, but he said it was awesome.   My experience here was good (hence the A-OK rating), but didn't leave me wanting come back for more. What did, however, was their happy hour menu: lots of great looking deals for $5. I'll have to head over for hh and will update my review.

xueYmreq--kCHDGEmsBRqQ.text: Like the other reviews happy hour was amazing!  Great basil lemonade!   Started out with the smashed avocado (guac).  Excellent since it was table side so we could pick & choose (not too much onion).   Doug ordered the Flat iron steak.  This was much better than he was expecting!  I had the angel hair pasta with shrimp.  Too salty!  Yes, i understand olives & capers but way way too salty!  It would have been delish, but... Thank you for the gluten-free option with the steak!  Service was Excellent!  We would go again.

ff9Y2xtKYOz7pEuaqF6gtA.text: I was a little underwhelmed by this place.    I will say that knowing the price of the food and this places location I was expecting an amazing restaurant.  When I walked in however I could tell that the place hasn't received a makeover in quite some time.  The fabric on the seats was all worn out and the interior didn't seem very fresh, seems like it could use a little TLC.  That being said...the food was good.  Split a flat bread, fries, and a queso dip with my cousin.  All three items were tasty. The fries are the only thing that really stick out to me as they were fried in duck fat, which was truly amazing.  I also had a gin and tonic that was mixed very well.  The service was also very good.   The only reason I am giving the place only two stars is really the price.  I dont feel like the food necessarily lived up to the price. Luckily I was there with someone who had a gift certificate.

7_ylWPrT2njKdxJpn58pyw.text: We just had drinks and a pizza. The prices are what you'd expect at a hotel, but the service was fantastic.

hv1vumRW05w4aKhyc9Qijg.text: I forgot how beautiful this hotel was (I haven't been here since a High School Prom in the early 80s) - I had the Best Ruben I've had in a long (Wow it was tasty!) it can with fries (Good) We also had the Queso Dip for the table (It was Good).

PMcok0GhsMKAHSxdr50HBg.text: It's not often that I would give a resort restaurant a good review.  Probably because we usually stray from them because they are often a billion dollars by the time you leave the place.  We decided upon dinner here while staying at the Biltmore for the Hell City Convention.  Since we live in town, I know the area pretty well so our options were anything in the Biltmore area or Frank & Alberts.  I had passed by the menu earlier and figured we'd try it.  We showed up about 6-7ish for dinner and there was no wait, but plenty of people inside.   We were nicely sat right next to the kitchen and almost instantly our drink orders were taken by the smiling Elizabeth. After our drinks we ordered our food and within 20min, our food was out.  While waiting for our food they gave us some bread and a couple dips that were delicious.  One was a chipotle ketchup and the other was a green olive aole type drip.  Both great.  We ordered some onion rings that came stacked in a nice formation along with some buttermilk ranch.  We all ate a few of those, but had saved more for later.  it was dinner time..    One of our friends had eaten so he grabbed a dessert that he said was one of the best he's ever eaten.  My girlfriend and I ordered the prime rib.  For $25, I thought this was a great price for such a fancy establishment.   I haven't had this tasty of a prime rib cut in a long time.  Every bite was better than the next.  Along with that was a huge piece of broccoli and a nicely cooked baked potato.  The meal was amazing.  But the meal was just a part of it..  Our server Elizabeth would always drop by to make sure we had what we needed.  They were so on top of things, if they over heard us comment on something, they would rush over to make sure we had it.  The staff was ridiculously nice and even the chef came out to check on our food.  I don't think I've ever had a better experience at a restaurant like  I did here.   Frank & Alberts knows food and knows how to take care of their customers.  Well done.  We loved this place so much that we werent here three times during our stay this past weekend.

-XaCjnCUK8IkiZdmDlkS-w.text: First of service is slow.  Food was ok but over priced.  Lastly make sure you check your bill cuz they automatically add 18% gratuity to it.

OhtQEHpwROkPrigxnEN4ZA.text: The hotel was a train wreck.  The restaurant on the other hand was better.  I ate more meals in this hotel restaurant than most.  Convenience was the big reason.  I had dinner the first night which was a burger.  The food was fresh and service was good.  The next morning I had breakfast which was just eggs and bacon but it was good.  The bacon was a little too undercooked and the toast was raw which happens sometimes but it was fixed right away. That same afternoon I got back to the hotel and sat down for lunch.  It was so hot outside that I wasn't really in the mood to eat but then I saw the Robert Redford peanut butter pie and decided to order that with a cup of coffee.  It was really good.

mUTEO1L3e_QOx0GDo9TToQ.text: Very disappointing Christmas dinner. Evening started poorly with restaurant not honoring what they advertise. Slow for server to acknowledge table. Ordered Shepard's Pie. Carrots and peas barely cooked, almost raw. Sent back. Daughter ordered a pizza. Crust so soggy could not be picked up.   Surprising as I have eaten at Wright's and found it very good. Would never return.

p2K8CGOIy20vt4gdAQ_PJg.text: If Architecture & Ambiance is your thing than this is the place for you!  Frank Lloyd Wright, and his draftsman, Albert Chase Mcarthur, are honored by naming their Phoenix architectural masterpiece at the Biltmore Resort's main restaurant after them...   The menu is good, the atmosphere a little dated, and there are a lot of blue hairs dining in this restaurant!   It was not cheap & there was not much there on the plate to fill me up! Overpriced & stingy portions are my big pet peeve... Great if your on a date & want to order desert & coffee to hang out though!  I like the old school ambiance of this place, what I didn't like was the waitress telling me the lunch salad was a good portion, I'm sitting here starving as I write this review! It was Tasty though, but unless you are a 5'7" 105 lbs super model this dish will not satisfy your hunger!   The reason I give it 2 stars is because I liked the food, & the atmosphere!

XosDjxjmjIFdxdYeYBVg6Q.text: Very bad experience.....had a reservation for a specific table outside for a month, called twice to confirm as it was a special birthday event. When we, a party of six arrived, our table was taken.  The food was average at best.....very disappointed!

c9IVxYM3K3rhbSgkNptGaA.text: Horrible service and disappointment for Easter . No plates or food in buffe line! Over cooked everything.... Total chaos or what they charge! Never coming back!

BEhPCwQq0_Ab_6gAYGsQOg.text: Slow service in the bar when there was no other patrons. I've been to Frank & Albert's many times, but what I've found is that unless your over the age of 55 and wearing designer clothing the staff would rather not serve you. The food was fairly good and the atmosphere nice. The prices are reasonable, however I probably won't return.

MYfdcWNhfQBfF2U2F_kGZQ.text: I had a superb meal during Arizona Restaurant Week. I started with a wonderful salad with an unusual form of green (it was stringy and fiberous, but it was good)-I will give them props for a unique and enjoyable twist on a salad. This was followed by a delicious filet mignon expertly prepared accompanied by french friends paoched in duck fat....just like they make in France!!!! this was topped off by a yummy banana and fruit parfait. The outdoor patio made for a really enjoyable atmosphere.  So why two stars? The service was apathetic from the moment we sat at the bar to order drinks. The bartender and later our server never smiled and acted like they could have cared less about looking after us. They were not overtly rude, but they certainly did not go out of their way to be the least bit pleasant and this made the overall experience VERY disappointing. This is The Biltmore, and I would expect warmer service for the level of diner that would typically patronize this restuarant.    Perhaps because it is The Biltmore, the staff feel the need to do their job with their noses in the air. Or perhaps because we were there for Arizona Restaurant Week, the staff were expecting a lousy tip and wanted to get us in and out as quickly as possible. I have to added that I went with some friends in the service industry. Depsite the bad service, we left 20 percent anyway. If it had been left up to me, I probably would have left 10 percent. There was nothing wrong with my order or my meal, but the collective attitude at that place sucked.  In any case, this experience left me with a very bad impression and I don't think I would go back. And this is unfortunate because the food is exceptional.

wmWhBLoHZcOcTmVp-FpiSA.text: Ate here tonight for the first time in ages. I really enjoyed this place. The service was great and the food was wonderful. We had a calamari appetizer, which was breaded with panko. Very good although the dipping sauce was a little ketchup-y. Probably wouldn't order it again. Had the tortilla soup-fabulous and one of the best I've ever had. We also had a duck and goat cheese pizza which was awesome and the crust was perfect. There's a lot of kvetching on here about the prices, but this is a high end resort so what do you expect?

XtLkSZ4WhY4PpMwXFDlqKQ.text: I really love this place, but today they did not bring their "A" game. I ordered my favorite for breakfast, the Biltmore Benedict, but instead I was served an impostor with overcooked poached eggs. Service was ehh, but overall everything was just okay, and that's where the disappointment lies.

cnkkR22VxWAUbjrHNnJXpQ.text: We've been to Frank and Alberts every day during our stay at the Biltmore and have had excellent service! Kala was incredible!

SgsHQU6YmafP7hvtvawzlg.text: We are here twice on vacation. The first day, it took ten to fifteen minutes for someone to acknowledge our table. Our waitress was deeply apologetic that no one let her know they seated us in her section. She made up for the issue with complimentary chips and guacamole. The food was good, but timing on entrees was totally off. Our children received their pizza ten minutes before we received our salads.  The second time we dined there, I ended up with food poisoning from their burger. Service this time was very attentive...but it doesn't help when the kitchen staff are serving subpar food.

nLRrMw5xSPUp0QMPGkHO-Q.text: If you go here, I highly recommend making reservations! Went here yesterday for breakfast at 9am and was told that it was a 20 min wait...that is ridiculous! Other couples/people were waiting as well and were equally upset at the long wait time. I was super pissed when a few seconds after putting in our name, management walked up to the hostess with a couple and they were immediately seated. Do you know how unprofessional and rude that was??! Pretty sure I had smoke coming out of my ears at that point!  Other then that, service was good and the food was yummy.

mw_difgJh_RQTqOshZwA3A.text: This is my first time here but loved it as soon as We walked in.  We were offered a taste of the pepper infused vodka!  It had a kick!  I had the pork belly tacos and my husband had the burger.  Our server, Desiree was attentive and informative.  We'll be back!

C6444oJ2jmzNIQdR9bToqQ.text: Frank & Alberts is on-site at the Arizona Biltmore Hotel so you're probably coming here because your company is paying for your room and you don't have a car.  Lucky for you it's delicious. Service was great, food was great, drinks were great so everything is great.  When I was in my room I noticed that they had a short rib mac & cheese on the room service menu. I got a hankering for this mac & cheese so when we came to the restaurant to eat I expected it to be on the menu, however it was not. Guess what? They made it for me anyway. It was delicious.  The cheesecake is made in house and I highly recommend it. You should come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheesecake- made in house
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short rib mac

Ar8Rt31jqhciP8JmHr4VnA.text: Not at all happy !!  Been here several times and tonight we waited over 90 minutes to get our dinner.   Really !!  You would think that a high class hotel would have a restaurant that takes care of their customers!!  Obviously not here!!

WV3E72pMBIf9LF1yVj6jYw.text: I stayed at the Biltmore for my 25th birthday and my parents and I wanted to have a nice dinner. We are all three vegan and they were so accommodating to our evening and dietary preferences. Kayla L was our waitress and she is a True gem. Thank you for making our evening so special and nice. Great food, also the chef is a master dough maker and if you have the chance try his pita pizza dough or both... you won't be disappointed.

6R0C9D2zgDKYknpiF4ZjbQ.text: We are staying at the Biltmore, so Frank & Albert's will see us many times during our 4 night stay.  Spinach salad - Very good.  It came with a ton of cranberries and walnuts.  No skimping here.  I would order it again. Pretzel appetizer - The cheese was great, but the pretzel was a pretzel bread and too dense.  I would not order this again. Steak & Eggs - Flat Iron steak was cooked perfectly and tasted great.  Eggs were cooked perfectly as well.  I would definitely get this again.  Chicken and waffles - The chicken was great.   The corn puree was excellent.   The waffles were good.  3 waffles and 2 pieces of chicken.   The jalapeno maple syrup is a little spicy. If you're not big eaters,  you can split it with a small side.    French toast - 4 pieces.   You can get a side dish and split everything.   It was OK.  I'd go with the chicken and waffles instead.

PIVnLuwDI3fzWLaMBF87Qw.text: I realized I made a mistake in reserving a table at Frank & Albert's upon arrival. Their website makes it seem the restaurant is more upscale then it actually is. The place was full of people in swimming trunks and rubber flip flops. I was totally out of place in a simple cotton maxi dress (nothing fancy). The ambiance was no better than Olive Garden and the service was horrible. The only thing that matched a more upscale dining experience was the price of the food, which did not live up to the price.  Our waiter took over five minutes to even come to our table to offer water. Then he forgot my husband's beer. Then our entrees were clearly forgotten about for a while, because they came lukewarm. Then he forgot to bring the dessert menu. And the place was not crowded. From what I could tell, he was managing 2-3 tables.  For food, we got the smashed avocado, which was good. For our main entrees, we got the mushroom ravioli and the chicken panzanella. As I mentioned, both were lukewarm at best and I could tell from how the pasta looked that it was starting to dry out. The meals tasted okay, but certainly not worth the price of $21 and $25. When we finally were able to get a dessert menu, we chose the strawberry cheesecake. I chose it because of the added kumquats (I wanted to see what it was all about). Well, there were no kumquats on it -- just strawberries.   To add insult to injury, I made the reservation on OpenTable, which I've used countless times with other restaurants in the past with no problems. This time I received an email from OpenTable advising that I was a NO-SHOW and that now I have to request a review, otherwise my no-show will negatively impact my ability to make future reservations via OpenTable.   After dinner we took a stroll around the Biltmore's grounds and frankly, the entire place was a disappointment. Of course the architecture of the original buildings is amazing, but the landscaping is in horrible condition, the public restroom was filthy, and just not the overall five star Waldorf Astoria experience one would expect. The place just looks tired.

frShhI-ikao-dmZM9c8Fqg.text: Decent hotel restaurant. Good food and reasonable service but cocktails were TERRIBLY overpriced. Also beware of the beer offering, some were not really good.

lkQv9riUD76UM2f1gCikAg.text: Sad to say, nothing impressive here. I had family staying at the Biltmore so we ate here. A tasteless hamburger similar to Fry's grocery store meat. Salad was no different then anywhere. I don't know where the reviewers normally eat but this place has nothing special to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quinoa salad
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheeseburger

EJ648ktQWKKx3flteZMDzw.text: Huge disappointment. Service was horrible. Our food sat under heat lamp for 15 minutes, we were watching it and couldn't get anyone to bring it to us. Had to wave our arms in the air to get water refilled. Drinks were ok, standard. Food was decent after they remade it for us. In the end we had to flag down a manager to bring us a bill, waitress just never came back. The table never did get bussed. It wasn't busy, just poorly trained staff.

vRGSVTXV5rP1KUSUDK2iXw.text: Really bad experience.  Arrived at 9:30 with myself and my hungry 7 year old granddaughter.  Was told by the hostess to wait just 5 minutes. 45 minutes later, I was told there were no longer tables available. I was told we could sit in open seating area. No waiter came to take our order. Left to find breakfast at another restaurant more than an hour later. Talked to the hostess and now with no line at all she still wouldn't seat us. We left after more than an hour of our time completely wasted!

aDxTBB3LjCO06PZmyFdbgw.text: Amazing hearty food, nice atmosphere and helpful staff. My daughter and I had dinner here and we were pleased with our restaurant choice. We started off with the Smashed Avocado served with tortilla chips and pico. The ingredients were fresh and the serving was just right, not to large and not to small. It allowed us to have enough room for dinner. After debating all the enticing choices, I decided on the Chili Braised short ribs, that were served with Hayden Mills Grits, roasted poblano and tomato. Holy cow! Talk about upscaling meat and grits to another level. It was fantastic comfort food at a good price for the quality. The serving size was just right as well.   My teen daughter enjoyed her choice of the Chicken Pilard. She allowed me to take a bite and it was full of fresh flavors.  Five stars and two thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Frank and Albert entrance

sEQ_sQzUkIPFm4m7pDOmxg.text: Just called Frank & Alberts restaurant (eve of 3/17/19) to book a dinner reservation for my husband's birthday.  The concierge connected me to the restaurant and nobody answered.  I called back TWO more times (at 15 minute intervals) and still NOBODY answered.  I called the concierge back AGAIN and asked to be connected to the restaurant manager and after being put on hold for FOUR minutes, he comes back to tell me I may not get through to the manager but I will get his voicemail.  Well THAT did not happen.  The Restaurant Manager has NO voicemail.  For a  hotel resort that touts itself on it's recording (while you are waiting forever on hold) to cater to the RICH and FAMOUS, you would think someone would ANSWER the phone at this restaurant after calling three separate times 15 minutes apart.  Maybe the hotel is short on staff.  I will call again tomorrow and see where I get.  I was just going to ask if the dinner menu that they posted online is all they have to offer or if there is more and if the one posted online is only an example of what there is to eat.  If this is all they have, it is a little light on choices and a lot of spicy food which may not appeal to everyone.  One star for me on this resort and if it weren't for the namesake of Frank Lloyd Wright, they would probably be out of business with this kind of service.

5YxLTqKPxYBcRCc9glKg-w.text: They have the best pork chops and hamburgers I've ever eaten! Servers are nice. John was very friendly and personable. This place is my go-to for a hot date.

bnMJ4woj7PXvQzVg3Twc7g.text: Went for lunch during my first day at Arizona Biltmore. Restaurant was recommended by the young lady who checked us in.   I went with the burger and my wife went with the fish tacos. Both were very tasty and in line with what you'd expect at a beautiful venue such as Frank and Alberts.   What really stood out was the service. Our server was Sherri and she was absolutely amazing. Took some time to hold a conversation with us and recommended some things to do during our visit to Phoenix.   We also had questions about some of the dishes and Sherri gave us real 'get this, don't get that' answers which I really appreciate. Versus 'everything is great here'. Even though everything may be great, of course some things are better than others.   So yeah, I appreciate the awesome service, and delicious food. We will definitely be back this week!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger and Fries. Nom nom nom!!!

Xz2nqQY5wsz6RDy7qnLW3Q.text: So we ate here twice-Dinner was pretty much terrible. I had a salad that was beyond bland with basically no dressing. My entree was the short rib. It was about 2 oz of meat and attached was a 3 oz blob of fat. Pretty gross! Breakfast- a little better but tiny portions with burnt potatoes. I'm being king with the 2 star....

5WffKW2cq6DcOJhA308tjg.text: Honestly the food was good, and the service was personable. Had drinks and two meals here and was real pleased with how it came out. Zee, Lisa and bartender Shawn All took very good care of us. The scallop risotto was amazing as were the sandwiches at lunch.

Qfa5fqcA9Kj7-yN6Jg2OnQ.text: Two nights in a row we were so disappointed. First night had to send my steak back twice for it being red when I requested medium well. After the whole ordeal taking so long I didnt want it anymore.   Second night service was terrible and our order was messed up and took forever as we were told the kitchen was backed up... There was only 4 seated tables  in the dining room?? I have never encountered so many issues at a restaurant nor one I would expect to have a higher standard all the way around.

IN4uS5T87848Uenebexkxg.text: Would love to see them offer healthy options.  Whole wheat pasta, salads with lite dressings and more vegetarian vegan options would be great!   The biscuits with sausage gravy, shake and bake pork, double stuffed potatoes and pizza are great, but will kill you eventually.

EqFsfgMwW5BeBbQ0-9y6BQ.text: I ate here for breakfest four days in a row during my stay here.  I want to say that Sherri is by far the best server (though there was a black guy who served us one morning that was also awesome!)  There isn't a huge menu here but still you can get pretty much any breakfest food like yogurt, eggs, omelets, pancakes or a buffet.  My husband tried the Mexican pizza and although it was good it did make him sick later in the day.  Each of my times here I had the decaf coffee and it was very good!  I had the omelette twice and another day the Sonoran benedict.  The Sonoron benedict probably was my favorite item- it had eggs benedict over a pulled pork and a nice tomato salsa.  The other day I had the almond cherry foccacia french toast and it was okay.  It was a huge slab of french toast smothered with almond butter.  It was just too rich for me.  I wasn't actually a huge fan of it but it was still okay to try.  I can't speak on Frank & Albert's for lunch or dinner, but if you are staying here it was quick service and the food came out quickly as well.

9obn__FMGboQ5LRlEWPnCA.text: so awesome great salmon/bagel breakfast dark coffee! and the chicken cashew salad is rockin!

EI2TtcpOeeoMkmKdiXusew.text: Ask for Mary for a wArm and entertaining service experience. She was helpful and gave good suggestions try the heirloom tomatoes.

78jJNxV373okwCNKo99zCw.text: Family dinner out on the patio by the fireplace on a perfect March evening can't get much better then that but wait! there's more.  We ordered calamari for an appetizer. It was perfectly fried not greasy at all with a side of  delicious cocktail sauce. I ordered a small organic caesar you get a choice of celery root or organic regular. I chose the celery and it was delicious, perfect portion. If you like more lettuce then get the regular caesar. Then I ordered the chicken and goat cheese desert flat bread pizza. It was more than I could eat but I sure tried to finish it. It was delicious nice moist chicken with the tang of the goat cheese and sweet figs. The desert flat bread was a nice alternative to a regular pizza dough. Great combination of ingredients. All in all a great experience! Katy was our server she was attentive but not breathing down our necks. I cant' wait to go back!

6u1ip5-P_sua1Xa_9LGVvg.text: Had a delightful lunch after a trip to the spa with my better half.  Service was a bit slow but good food and good drinks in a casual setting.  Definitely worth checking out if you're staying at the Biltmore or in the neighborhood.

mVI5VmTwjiw-O0Q53XCJiA.text: Creative, excellent food with good service, but you'll pay.  I had an amazing mascarpone (not MARscapone, dammit!) stuffed french toast.  Fascinating preparation, as it was served as a "brick" (imagine quartering a loaf of bread and then splitting it in half).  Had a honey drizzle, some luscious strawberries and real maple syrup.  Absolutely delicious.  My friend's omelet was equally as tasty.  Setting is gorgeous and service was good.  Only downside is resort pricing -- $11 for the (admittedly excellent) french toast and $4 for coffee (I passed).  Yum.

_hRq9_7JX80vtpFAqrwaog.text: We ate at this restaurant with a group of 7 people. We were seated outside behind the fireplace at about 6 pm on a Sat night in early April. The service was absolutely deplorable.  The server was very slow and never asked us if we wanted refills on drinks, forgot an entire appetizer order and had to be found to pay the bill. The only really good thing on the menu was the onion rings. The Sea Bass was loaded with Salt, but otherwise dry. My daughters hamburger was not medium, but over done...hard as a rock. My wife's apple salad was mostly apples. We had to ask several times to get more bread and waited over an hour each time for our food. When we mentioned to the waiter that the appetizer order was completely forgotten, his response was " oh sorry," with no offer of anything complimentary to make up for the error.  The service was possibly the worst I've ever had and my family is in the restaurant business and I've eaten at a multitude of places

VcwJm82pTirjMFNj-8ZhCg.text: Stay away!  We REALLY expected MUCH more at this high end property.  Food was just ok, and DID NOT live up to the room prices at this establishment.  They should be ashamed!  But the REAL issue was the service.  Not nearly enough staff on duty and those that were there were poorly trained.  We sat down at 6:30 pm with the dining area not nearly full and still waited over an hour for our meal.  Total time in the restaurant - 2 3/4 hours!  We were given the wrong menus, but the error was not caught until AFTER we had ordered.  When our meal was finally served we had no utensils to eat it with.  When we asked for them they were not brought, so we had to get up and steal them from a nearby table.  Nobody cared.  Remember, this is the BILTMORE!  Bus staff did not have a clue as to what they were there for - knocked things over and reached in front of us to clear the table.  We ordered wine with our entrees and it did not arrive until we asked the Manager to bring it half way through our meal.  Final insult was that the bill was wrong and had to be sent back for correction.  The waiter then had the nerve to give us a littany of excuses as to why things went so wrong when he brought the incorrect bill.  As I said, STAY AWAY.

mRefEod_c0EPkANKtRgk-g.text: From lunch to dinner both meals were excellent, for my dinner experience my server Joshua was great with not only service but his recommendation of the meatloaf was just right and he mentioned if I was here for lunch I should try the pizza well he was right again.

BFD5dDMo_Sl8ScjMwHY5Vg.text: I've been for lunch a few times now and have been negligent in adding a review - since I've been two times in the passed 30 days or so it's a perfect time to add a review! I have had the pleasure of eating here in large groups (15-20) and a smaller more intimate table (2-4). The service is usually quite good and the staff attentive. The staff all seem to know the menu and able to make recommendations. I think my favorite thing on the menu is the BLT Taco with Hibiscus BBQ sauce - it's yummy AND pretty! Last time I went there I was served by a lovely gal with purple hair. It made me happy to see that they're not so stuffy there that they turned her away (as someone with blue hair I'm always pleased to see that people don't think your hair color speaks to a person's character). The Biltmore doesn't have a whole lot of restaurant options on site, but this IS a good choice (both with food quality and pricing) so you don't have to stray off the hotel grounds when you're staying here!

JgYAEgAk4Q0uoWsaX8ePAA.text: My husband and I had a reservation, but we were seated and no one came to see us for nearly 10 minutes. After we finally got our water ordered another server came over and asked if we had been helped yet knowing we had been sitting there for some time. We get our water still another few minutes later even though there was only 3 other tables in the whole place and we ordered the smashed avocado appetizer. It was not impressive. The chips are bland and the bowl of guacamole is tiny. After we finished that, our server asked if we would like to order dinner, so we ordered the house special (steak with fries), and the meatloaf. The steak was tiny with a tiny basket of fries, and the meatloaf was basically a giant hamburger with ketchup on top. The mashed potatoes that it says it comes with are a couple of spoonfuls under the meatloaf, so there isn't much. The service was no better than if we went to a fast food place and the food is not worth the $85 we spent on the 3 things we got. We could have gotten better food at a fast food restaurant for 1/4 of the price. When our server brought the check over she wouldn't let me write in our room number and last name since we are also staying at the hotel. She wrote it in for me as if I wasn't able to write it in myself or I wouldn't have paid the bill. We have been to plenty of nice restaurants that we are willing to pay more for and never have we been treated as young, poor couple who wouldn't pay. Never going back. I also would recommend others to not go if you want good service and good food. Since we are staying at the hotel, this is the place to get breakfast. We came to get the breakfast buffet, but we again waited to have a server come to our table to take our order. She didn't bring water or coffee for a bit of time, then took our plates after they were stacked 5 high and had been sitting there for almost our whole meal. She then brought our check without ever checking in to see if there is anything else we needed. We had asked for cream for our coffee and got a small cream for one person, but we both had coffee. When she left the check, I asked her for more cream so we both could have our coffee with cream and she didn't bring it. A busser ended up bringing it over and asked if we needed anything else, which is more customer service than we have gotten the whole meal. We are thoroughly uninterested in coming back here. It seems since we are young, we don't get service because everyone else around us is older and has gotten 10x he amount of service as us. Sorry but we are young and not tipping well because your service is terrible not because we are young and poor. We make plenty of money to leave you a great tip, but didn't because we tipped you what you earned. After our experience with breakfast being similar, but worse than our experience with dinner, I moved the rating from two stars down to one.

fBHVY4bq_mGuX1pj5X7erg.text: We stopped to see what was new. It changed since we last stayed there. Loved the bars. Our bartender Shane was attentive. We had traditional breakfast and an omelette. The local bread was so good and the bloodymary was really spicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trio meat omelet
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Traditional breakfast
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Schriener chicken sausage

jYLqFBoGR-pJOUoyfTOiFA.text: Food was good but service was terrible. Server, Maria, would not come talk to us until we were looking around the restaurant wondering who are server was. Keep in mind the restaurant was not busy and we had seen our server just standing around for quite a bit. Then we give her our order and she brings it and a couple minutes later drops the check, she does not even bother to ask how our food is and never came back, she just assumed we would bill it to a room. Will not be going back. This concludes a string of 3 visits with mediocre service at best. We only went back because it is one of two restaurants at the Biltmore.

xnWtMhIc7nZf8vWS54MaZA.text: We usually only eat breakfast here during our stay at the Biltmore and it is always good. The husband usually gets the buffet, which in my opinion is WAY over priced ($28), and it is usually always fresh. Just always check it out first because he got the buffet yesterday and it had biscuits and gravy....which I was excited for today....but when I got up there to get them, it was a dish that looked really sad (not sure what it was honestly). The buffet has a great omelet & egg station, has a fantastic fresh fruit section and a wide variety of nice pastries. With all of that being said about the buffet....I have to point out my absolute favorite breakfast dish. The Huevos Rancheros is so good!!! We come from New Mexico where Huevos Rancheros is the "King" of breakfast...and I really have to say, that this HR is one of my favorites!! Now, it is really nothing like the NM Huevos Rancheros....it is completely different (very fresh), but so good. I highly recommend this establishment for breakfast!

vmoMA1eYsNtnltEkMGmWSw.text: This restaurant should not be in the Biltmore and it's over priced simply because it is. First bad sign, crumbs all over the booth (well having booth seating was the first bad sign). Second bad sign, the recommended smashed avocado appetizer (badly in need of seasoning) came a good 8-10 minutes before our cocktails (we ordered cocktails before we ordered our appetizer). Third bad sign, the appetizer was brought and two of our party still didn't have silverware or appetizer plates (we had to ask for them after we waited with the appetizer sitting in front of us for five minutes WITHOUT COCKTAILS). Fourth bad sign, the house specialty meatloaf was swimming in their 'homemade chipotle ketchup' that was sweet rather than spicy. Fifth bad sign, our waiter finally showed up to ask how everything tasted (we were starving so the diner food they served was adequate, not great, not horrible but simply adequate) when we were almost done and sorely in need of a second round of cocktails (which basically ended up being dessert). Don't get me wrong, all of the food was fine. But fine isn't good enough if you're charging $28 for 'signature' meatloaf that is absolutely nothing special. I'm from Chicago and hadn't been to the Biltmore in years so I was super disappointed in their casual restaurant. Let's hope our experience at the fine dining restaurant is much better, although I'm reconsidering our reservation after this diner, uh dining experience.

sROlefydTUGRqvViPkvenA.text: One of the Restaurants in the Biltmore Resort, we have had brunch several times at Wright's the other restaurant in the resort which was good but we wanted to try out the more casual atmosphere at Frank & Alberts. The decor inside was underwhelming aside from the walls and exterior which is classic Frank Lloyd Wright style definitely the more "family friendly" restaurant. Service was fine fairly average nothing was blatantly bad. Now the question to buffet or not to buffet?? That was the question. After our entrees the buffet at $21 dollars would only be $4 or $5 dollars more so it probably would have been a better deal I just wasn't in the mood to have the valet use a crowbar to help me into the car. One person in the party had the buffet I took a peek and it looked fairly standard. I had the build your own omelette with ham and spinach, it was very average, certainly not bad but not great. The fingerling potatoes were good smothered in onions which I didn't care for, some potatoes very cooked others hardly cooked. My toast had a bit of a delay arriving at the table but no big deal. I added sausage which was very good. Another friend at the table had pineapple upside pancakes which were good but incredibly sweet. My partner had the prime rib hash, corn, chili rojo, peppers, potatoes and fried eggs. Salty but delicious! To summarize whether you are staying at the resort or not check out at least a restaurant or two there if anything for the history rather than the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biltmore Resort
