Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Build your own omelette

gNDXTpYjz7HSU5UfWqulag.text: Exceptional service from the moment we arrived-- from valet to host to server, every thing was exquisite. Our server Fabian went above and beyond for us when we told him we were celebrating my boyfriend's promotion. He was knowledgeable and answered all of my questions. Also, Fabian made sure to check back on us every chance he got throughout our dining experience. I know this review is about the restaurant itself, but I believe Fabian is what made our experience a pleasant one. He's an amazing asset to the team, make sure to request him when you arrive!

EgFoA8oi0p6VVS-sLCWhQw.text: While I was happy to have an on-resort breakfast option, I thought this place was a bit overpriced (expected) for what I got (unexpected). I knew the prices were high, but I was hoping the food would match. It did not.  I ordered the vegetarian omelet (+ goat cheese). It came with a side of fried potatoes and bread (I got an English muffin). The omelet was small, and the ONLY reason it was good was the goat cheese I requested. Otherwise it would've been bland AND unfulfilling. The potatoes (red and purple) were pretty tasty and well done, but since I'm eating low carb, I let my daughter enjoy them. Everything needed salt. The English muffin came out completely black on one side. That was the icing on the cake for me.   The salt and pepper on my table needed refilled. There was nothing in either. Fortunately we snagged a set form an empty table. The service was good.   Husband's salad came with a ginger dressing that was the texture and sweetness of jelly. really odd. And not tasty.   Overall, food was disappointing. Interior was clean and pretty. Service was nice. I wouldn't waste money on breakfast again though.

ovAbyEl8MymarhTRgyaxmg.text: Such a beautiful setting!! We popped in for an early dinner 5p, on a Sunday. Just wanting to enjoy the gorgeous AZ weather and have a decent meal.   Mind you, this is a Waldorf Astoria property!!! That being the case, you expect a certain level of service.   "Service" - Our server, Ken N. was disheveled, dirty uniform and had a flippant, dismissive manner. He never told us about the specials either. We later overheard another server letting her table know about specials. He never came back to see if we needed more water or anything else. We ordered cappuccinos and he didn't bring the sugar or spoons. We asked for them, he then brought the sugar, no spoons, we asked for spoons again... by the time we had what we needed, they weren't hot and my experience was tainted.   "Food" - The shrimp cocktail was really a joke. For 21.00, we assumed it would be 3-4 jumbo shrimp/prawns. There were 4 very small, grocery store-like shrimp on a plate. Husband's pizza was excellent and a good value. My caesar salad with salmon was excellent and a good value. The cappuccinos, aside from being warmish, weren't anything that I would expect from The Waldorf Astoria. Maybe it's just me, but I would expect some kind of presentation... maybe a small spoon and a cube of raw sugar, a small biscotti, a doily, lol.. something!   Disappointed at best. We didn't even have alcohol and our bill was 100.00. Had the service been adequate, the cost vs. everything else probably wouldn't have even registered with me.   ** Here's the scariest part ** Ken was training a new server!! He was talking really loud and authoratative so everyone on the patio could hear that he was training. God help her!!!

HePjO5iCHFKROqgYNcVpRg.text: Good menu with lots of options.  Service was fast and friendly.  It was a hot day and there was plenty of shade and misters to keep it cool.

T-ohKlYZweD-KDNHeynheA.text: Good food, small portions, limited menu especially at lunch. Breakfast buffet is overpriced but lunch prices are reasonable for resort. Pizza, salad, soup very tasty. Apple pie good but mini size. Friendly service, Would come back

zFfLO6XOJeuKAmVEtT4VEA.text: It Was Great!! Wasn't Planning Much but R&R For Memorial Weekend- When We Decided to Go Out for Dinner.  Frank & Albert's Was On our Preferred Fine Dining Card (Good for Bogo ) It's a Great Way to Try New Restaurants and Ones Perhaps Off the Main Area You Live.  We Went for Happy Hour Which they Have 3-6 EVERY Day- So We Were Able to make a 7:00 Res. & Went at 5:00 -5:30 to Have a Drink & Check Out Menu.  It was Great Choices at HH are Limited But Reasonable Select Drinks, Beers & Wine or $4-$5-$6 & Some Bites $5  The Meatloaf Sliders were Recommended & They Were Great !! Tasty!! For Dinner we Had the Ribeye Served with Cheesy Scalloped Potatoes Tomato & Asp. So it was a Whole Dinner for $40.  Along with a Shared Ceasar Salad.  Excellent Service by Lisa, and We Went for Broke & Shared a Cheesecake for Dessert.  Delish !!   We Are looking Forward to Going Back to this Beautiful Property.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shared a Large Caesar Very Good
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great Value  2 Meals At Designated Restaurants Each Visit One Entree FREE  !!
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy Hour 3-6 Everyday

8fi-qNTD0EiP4CZ8Kzmy_g.text: If you have are staying at the Arizona Biltmore in Phoenix or just happen to be nearby, try Frank & Albert's for both a pleasant and tasty bite to eat. It is located within the Biltmore and they serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. I think you will find the menu diverse and inviting with many tempting options. The service is good and the wait staff is attentive, knowledgeable and engaging.  The last time my wife and I ate here was for lunch in May. She had the crab cake sandwich and I ordered a blackened shrimp couscous salad. I also had a glass of the Caymus Conundrum - always very drinkable.  I tried my partner's crab cake sandwich and it was delicious. It included bacon, lettuce and tomato. The sea salt fries are one of my favorites. My shrimp couscous salad consisted of olives, cucumber, roasted tomato, beets with a nice vinaigrette. The shrimp were large and flavorful.   This restaurant is a good value for your dollar and worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WPQTdSpaNoutNhzu2536Pw.text: A great place for casual eats at the Arizona Biltmore. Our waitress, Justine, made the experience so memorable. Her bubbly personality and enthusiasm made us feel at home.   The cauliflower steAk was ok but nothing exciting and kind of mushy.  The pretzels with beer cheese were great!  The chicken tortilla soup was bomb!  The shaved Brussel sprout salad was more of a slaw but delicious.   All in all a good experience.

efhVAuxDwq0xlmyIJu6WVg.text: I had a week long conference at the Biltmore and tried most of the things on the menu. Everything was really good. The staff and environment is fantastic. Now to the important stuff...  Steak and Eggs: 5 Stars Italian Sandwich: 3 Stars Traditional Pizza: 3 Stars Burger: 4 Stars Fish and Chips: 5 Stars French Fries: Infinity Stars

Mm7qOWpv5e3hoH3_xdS0fg.text: Super nice staff, food was delicious, and great environment. The only reason a star was taken was because the menu did not describe when a dish would be spicy. We have a toddler and the meatloaf entree was ordered for him, but it tasted spicy so he ate my husband's burger instead. Other than that it was a great experience!

U9mk6N8GArNp5g3Q0pJVGQ.text: I met an industry colleague at Frank & Albert's this week for a holiday lunch.  We sat at a lovely table next to the firepit on the patio - what a lovely way to enjoy lunch in early December in the desert!  Our server was friendly and professional and my salad was absolutely delicious!  I highly recommend the ancient grains power salad with quinoa, farro, kale, sweet potatoes, pomegranate seeds, pears, goat cheese, cranberry relish with shrimp and a citrus white balsamic vinaigrette...so seriously tasty!

0hvmSk_Q34mDxuFMl3S3CA.text: The saving grace for this place is the kitchen. The food is delicious and is made very quickly, the service on the other hand......  Was disappointed to get to the host stand and an employee was cleaning a table nearby. After we were not greeted for a few minutes he said "Have you been helped? No? There should be two hostesses up here, so they must be busy". He then walked away and left us to wait. After a hostess finally showed up to seat us, she informed us our server, Maria, would be right with us. 10 or so minutes went by and we still had yet to be greeted by our server. I noticed a lady leaning on a counter with her back towards us doing nothing for a few minutes, having a strong suspicion she might be Maria. After she finally turned around and walked in our direction, I made eye contact in an attempt to get her attention, to which she responded "Oh you're ready now?". As she came to take our order, I saw her nametag, thus confirming my suspicion that she was, in fact our server. We had a simple order of water with no ice and a sandwich, nothing else, but the water came with loads of ice and she quickly dropped them off and left the table. We were enjoying the food (which she did not even bother to perform a quality check on, but luckily the kitchen did great) and were about halfway through with when she came by and dropped the check, once again walking away before giving us a chance to say anything. She must have assumed (without asking) we were charging it to the room, because even though we finished our food, she never returned to ensure we were actually billing it to the room instead of our card or cash. We were there to celebrate an anniversary and have a relaxing staycation, but the service experience really left much to be desired. I will not be returning, or let alone recommending this place to friends or family.

z9D5ExjnfxqhLmp4enr03w.text: I don't usually go to a hotel restaurant with high expectations, so I was pleasantly surprised when my food arrived. I ordered the Organic Celery Ceaser, and was definitely impressed. A very unique salad of julienned celery, some romaine, garlic croutons, parmesan, and a flavourful dressing. Plus my server Brittany was great!  Big thumbs up.

rVzYpIaj7YBhy9mMKcWO9w.text: Was at the Biltmore Fashion Park and headed over to the restaurant based on local recommendations. It was not very good.  The food was bad and the service was worse. The self-proclaimed famous tortilla soup had little-to-no flavor and used canned vegetables.  I ordered a salad that was supposed to come with a vinaigrette but instead came with a thick creamy dressing that tasted like tangy ranch.  On to the service: after we were seated it took 10 minutes for an older blond waitress to even notice us and it wasn't even that busy! When she asked for our drink order, she seemed upset that I just ordered a lemonade, it was weird.  Then we asked for bread, which we never got. After she brought the check we reminded her and she was just like "whoops".  I imagine she is the sister of the owner or something.   She came back with bread that we were able to use to clear our palates of that awful meal.  Another negative is the price: soup and salad for two plus one lemonade cost us $60! For terrible tasting, poor quality food.  One positive is that the kitchen is fast. They got the orders to us right away.    So, if you are in the mood to be treated poorly and eat bad, expensive food, then this place is for you.  Otherwise stay away.

IF-80WmHyNNbdn19LJvp3g.text: Stayed at the Biltmore and had breakfast here twice and drinks outside. I missed the breakfast menu but they were able to accomodate me both days. I ordered egg whites with cheese and they were good each time. The price was different each time for the same thing, but other than that the food was good.  The service was excellent for both food and cocktails.

3e2qsLc-ueIk8IrE98I79g.text: We often stop in or bring friends to Frank and Alberts, specifically for their fabulous peach Bellini.  While we aren't typically keen on frozen drinks, we have celebrated many occasions sipping on the frozen, peachy deliciousness.  Today we stopped in with a friend after a long bike ride.  When we found out they were out of a key ingredient, we were crestfallen.  Our server, Lisa, went the extra mile to seek out the missing ingredient elsewhere in the resort so she could serve us our favorite Bellinis!  Thanks again, Lisa!

MqxJwsWFkJ54kYequuJQ8w.text: This was such an amazing surprise to our trip out to Arizona. We stayed at the Biltmore and decided to try Frank & Alberts for our first breakfast and never went anywhere else.  My husband and I eat organically, so it was a delight to actually find a REALLY good restaurant that offers these options for people like us. The staff was absolutely delightful! They remembered our names, gave us exceptional service, and really made the whole experience just wonderful. The chef also came out and paid us a visit, which is always good in my book as you are never able to give the proper compliments to their hard work.  For breakfast, definitely try the eggs benedict! Their twist on it was a unique delight for someone who is an eggs benedict lover. They use a smoked pork loin vs a ham and their hollindaise was to die for!  For dinner, definitely try the bass. For cocktails, you MUST try the Lavender and Lemons martini. Lavender infused vodka with lemonade and candied violets.  The only thing I would request that they improve is their desserts. Two people in our party had their cherries jubilee and the bananas foster. Both felt more like ice cream with fruit vs the traditional (or even modified) application. It was a bit of a disappointment, but overall we were extremely pleased with this place!

TNnAp0iXVS-XgJv5JJMo4g.text: Had high hopes. Nice spot at the Biltmore Hotel. We sat on the patio, which nice. What wasn't so nice was the food and service. Overcooked fish, slow service and my wife's second drink was forgotten. At that point I can't even accept the kind free dessert. Nothing horrible about F. and A., just not good enough at the moment to go back.

eMvZ_UrHYMji25RkOg4FMA.text: We ate at Frank & Albert's while staying at the Biltmore last weekend.  My family was visiting from New Hampshire and we had a large group (10). When we arrived, we were seated in a private room (which was great, since we did not request one).  The food was wonderful and my niece was so happy that Macaroni & Cheese was on the menu.  I actually had the same thing, since hers looked so delicious.  The Macaroni & Cheese was spectacular - I love trying it at nicer restaurants, and this one was in my top ten. Best of all, our server was the funniest and most accommodating server I've ever encountered. He handled my very Irish family perfectly :) I highly recommend that you ask for Krasi when you dine there!

wSoWfMGARX_PDMhDjCAGxQ.text: Excellent service, great food in a beautiful venue. Nothing not to like (well perhaps price, but you don't go to this restaurant for a cheap date!)

wZrbhCzY2Yy52WZp7fGVCg.text: It's a very nice atmosphere. The food is good. The Service is very good. The Biltmore is an amazing place and I think was looking for amazing. I had the chicken and goat cheese flat bread which was great. The next day I had their version of a French dip also very good.

qVWZWKv0ELpCFCRZDRwNbQ.text: I used to really enjoy dining at Frank & Alberts but a visit last week for dinner with out of town guests was really disappointing.  Started with the roasted tomato soup that tasted and had the mouth feel of diluted tomato paste. The meatloaf that I have enjoyed many times was just ok but the portion was much smaller than before. One of my companions stopped after two spoons of the soup and was also disappointed with the portion size of the meatloaf. Though incredibly uncrowded on a Saturday night the service was listless. And to boot when I got the check the server had added his gratuity without mentioning it to us. I am used to this latter practice for a party of 6 or more but we were only 4. I did complain to the manager but he did absolutely nothing!  If this represents the new Frank & Albert's its in serious trouble.  Permalink | Report | Reply

q2tC29OeL8jAPzJjGhPa-A.text: We visited Frank & Albert's on a Sunday afternoon for lunch.  Hardly anyone was there, as it was about 2:30 PM.  We had eaten lunch there a couple of years ago on the patio, and I had a great time then.  However, the temp was 114 on this particular afternoon, so the patio wasn't an option.  We were the only people in there other than the dude who talked on his phone the ENTIRE time we were there.  He even managed to order and eat his entire lunch while yapping.    I ordered fish tacos, as I had the last time we were there.  Something has changed.  A previous reviewer mentioned this, and he was on the money.  I received two constructed tacos . . .soft tortilla shells in the shaper with cabbage etc.  only no fish!  Two large-ish filets of fish were on the side!  It was really messy . . .I had to tear apart the filets with my fork, smash some fish into the full-of-cabbage tortillas, and complete my own taco :(  I gave up on the second one and ate the veggie taco and the fish separately.  I really didn't like the seasoning on the fish, either.  I thought it was too harsh and blackened.  Ultimately, the fish tacos were "meh" to say the most.  I will not order them again.  My bf ordered a sandwich and since he must follow a special diet, he cannot eat mayo.  He reads ingredients very closely and requests things he can't have be left off.  His sandwich came slathered in mayo, even though it wasn't mentioned on the menu as an ingredient.  When we looked around for our server, he was nowhere to be found.  So, while I munched on messy tacos, bf sat looking sad for the next 5-7 minutes until we finally saw the server and flagged him down.  That being said, the server was AWESOME about making the new sandwich sans mayo, and we even received an extra order of sweet potato fries with sea salt.  They were yummy!  And when you see their house "chipotle ketchup," DO try it!  I looked for it in the Biltmore gift shop, but they didn't have any for sale.  Oh well.    I am not swearing Frank & Albert's off forever, but since I am only in Phoenix a few times a year, it will be a while before I go again.

H9e4XEcNSjonHxIxwYxFQw.text: Terrible service!   Rude, uneducated and seemed annoyed when asking for simple things like butter or sugar.  They laugh and are outwardly rude.  Never saw a manager who oversaw things the three days while we were there.  Therefore, staff (at least ours) did what they wanted.  Won't go back again! Love the property and other restaurant.  This one is very mediocre.

RgoaC4wgsOxaGGhzPjo3eA.text: We thought the food was good and the atmosphere was great.  I thought the prices were a bit much for what you got.  I ordered the breakfast buffet for $20, it consisted of an omelette bar, yogurt-tini's, sausage, bacon, scrambled eggs, and some breads.  For a LOT less you get a LOT more at other places, but then again you're at the Biltmore.  The seating is very cool, lots of different set-ups, they even have a table in its own private glassed in room.  Service was nothing to write home about, I think our water was filled once after sitting empty for some time.  If you order coffee they give you a pot.

njnnng92_ncHB80Ru9UPRw.text: If you're here for happy hour and are sitting at the bar, this place is awesome, and the prices are great.  Come here for breakfast and you will see both a menu and a breakfast buffet that manage to be overpriced and limited in variety at the same time.  I would've gone elsewhere, but I've no rental car and the other restaurants at the hotel are closed.

0ygIUq6-xw-qA4d0PizJoQ.text: A delicious way to cap off a long day on the road to the Arizona Biltmore. We ordered the BR Cohn and the Kilt Lifter on the recommendation of our friendly server, Dannon. He did not steer us wrong all night...we had the "Desert Flat" for a starter which was simply amazing. It was a foccacia pizza with red onion marmalade, goat cheese, warm spinach, chicken (optional for veggies), and mandarin oranges. I might have to have it for lunch tomorrow!   The entrees: grouper for him, Waldorf salad for me, were also excellent, but I can hardly get the butterscotch pudding we had for dessert out of my head. It was salted to perfection and well worth every last bite!

1iofcbdtJmja92L93NzJjg.text: I took a friend of mine here for his 18th birthday.   Great food.

67HoX37UTWN-Lfvm7A3o7w.text: Nice place great food and service. We could definitely taste the quality in which the food has being hormone free meats and local farmed vegetables. The wheat germ crunch pancakes did not suck at all. I can't wait to enjoy the buffet on Sunday. Definitely go here if you like well cooked and clean tasting foods.

QvCalsE4l7a41zUcNMpf_w.text: We have lived in the Biltmore area for many years but did not go to Wrights or the Coffee Shop because it was not as good as other options.  The rework has been successful.  The Prime Rib in this location is better than the Fountain Bleu in Miami Beach.  Eat in the bar for a relaxed meal and cordial atmosphere.   The portions are big and the price is more than reasonable.  A wonderful experience.

B82EKvCu7K5_Veqj1LrWiw.text: decided to do a little appetizer tasting menu (of our own creation) here. the chili sundae was original and delicious. the duck-fat poached fries are a must-have with any meal. avoid the celery caesar salad. but then again, that doesn't even sound that good, does it?  they make kick-ass bloody marys too!

bqhzM4eHLf667x29l-pxSw.text: The breakfast here was amazing - wonderful oatmeal with cherry brulee.  The breakfast buffet was also excellent.  However, I give this restaurant two stars because of the dinner we had the night prior to the great breakfast.  The signature lemon lavender martini was very disappointing, as they were fresh out of lavender so they brought me a basic lemon drop martini.  The waiter highly hyped the lemon chicken that came with the "best mashed potatoes he'd ever had", so I ordered that.  The chicken (which was claimed to have been marinated in lemon all night long) had zero lemon taste to it.  Zero.  It was simple rotisserie chicken - good flavor but not what it claimed to me.  The mashed potatoes - I took one bite and without saying anything about them I had my fiance taste them.  His reaction was, "they taste like instant potatoes", which was exactly my thought!!!!!!  I was stunned since they were so hyped.  If I stay at the Biltmore again I definitely would not eat dinner here - I would try the nicer restaurant on the property or go off property.

e6kZdRSbkNhHxrDl2xH5IA.text: We were staying at the Biltmore and didn't really feel like leaving the property for dinner, so we gave this spot a try. Our server, Christian, was very friendly and responsive. He also knew a lot of great stories about the resort. There were a lot of interesting choices on the menu. I'm usually not much of a drinker, especially mixed drinks, but I was in the mood, so I tried The Spritz (very manly, I know). It was decent, but not great, especially for a $15 drink. As for the food, I went with the Sonoran Pizza, which was unique and quite tasty. My daughter tired a different pizza, the Southwest Traditional, and she ate the whole thing! My wife enjoyed the tortilla soup with the Sonoran Caesar salad, wile my other daughter tried the soup with the hummus appetizer. We were all pretty stuffed by the end, but the dessert menu was pretty attractive too. After some deliberation, I swayed the vote to the Tableside S'mores - definitely the right choice! If you are staying at the Biltmore, I would definitely recommend that you pay a visit to Frank & Albert's!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tableside S&#39;mores - yum!!!
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sonoran Pizza
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southwest Traditional Pizza

qVZjp5JldWCYJ_PCwIDhcA.text: Stayed at the Biltmore for 4 nights during the off-season and went here three times.   The first time I went was for happy hour as they have a reasonably priced menu. Had a beer, some wine, and guac. It was good.   The second time was for dinner as Wright's didn't have space for us. We got some drinks and ordered wings and pizza. It was better than I thought it would be.   Where both times struggled was the service. There was a bartender who was working both times (I can't remember her name. I think it started with a B). Her service was great. She was friendly and working hard. She was working extremely hard as she was bartending while also serving all the tables near the bar. It would take a few extra minutes to get in an order and get drinks, but no fault of her own. I simply think someone should have been staffing the seating area. This could be a result of it being offseason, but the hotness should be able to help out when not seating people.   The third time we came in for breakfast. It was pretty good. I particularly remember the home fries. I remember them so vividly because they were good. I say this because it can be so easy to make bland home fries and under-season them. They were seasoned so well that non-condiment was needed.   All in all, good HH, food is better than you might expect, though expect a little higher price, and the service could be better organized.

yxB83uOmkW4hGFn0gHXFxA.text: Ate at F&A's due to meeting at the hotel. I ordered a Southwest Chicken Salad and based on that I would likely not visit again. The salad was bland and I ordered dressing on the side, unfortunately they put it in a dish on the side but it tipped over and so I had a pool of dressing. Service was inattentive. Forgettable experience but one of a couple places in the hotel complex open for lunch so not a lot of options.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southwestern Chicken Salad

AS4vDKS6qYDRakLqJMLryg.text: I was tagging along on my husbands business trip and stopped by for breakfast. Amazing service. Hannah, my server, was amazing. She went above and beyond! The food and service was excellent. You won't want to pass up the opportunity to eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2SFDMVOyRtx5SF3vshBntg.text: recently stayed at the arizona biltmore, had some credits for food and drink so had to eat here for breakfasts and dinner on more than one occasion. menu was pretty limited. meat pizza was okay. salads were lackluster. skip the desserts. best thing i had was the cheeseburger and fries which was just okay. breakfast buffet was not worth it. the avocado toast was good, although one day i got two eggs and the other day i got one egg... which was odd. unfortunately we also ate at wright's which also had a limited menu. best food we had here was actually the free food in the concierge lounge.

H4GDB28XH3i6_keeUlqXQQ.text: The service here was amazing! The staff was all very friendly and the food was all very good. From scallops, to pizza, our party enjoyed each of the plates we ordered! Highly recommend!

7ybGZaHe1GoaWzX12GhTqA.text: Taking days off are a rare occasion for me.  Very long lunches? Yes. Leaving early? Most definitely. Holiday weekends? Guaranteed.  Taking a whole day off, with no plans and no work? Preposterous!  It was a beautiful spring day, and I decided to take the day off to enjoy the beautiful weather. I took the convertible out of storage and braved  the endless throngs of people out there.  Poor souls. They were rushing to work. While I was simply driving around looking for a place to enjoy a nice quiet breakfast, in stellar surroundings.  There's no better place to enjoy such a marvelous day than the Arizona Biltmore - one of Arizona's hallmark destinations.  As I pulled into the entrance, I was warmly greeted by the duo of Valets eager to park my car. It is always so refreshing to be greeted by folks that enjoy their jobs, and it showed on their faces.  I walked through the entrance, made a right, and instead of going to my typical destination here (Wright's restaurant), I went to Frank & Albert's.   This establishment was definitely bustling with golfer's and other guests that morning. Nearly every seat was taken, but since I was running solo, they didn't have any difficulty in promptly seating me.  As I was perusing their menu, I had great view of their open view kitchen. It appeared to be well run and efficient.  Speaking of efficient, I had no less than 3 servers check on me on a regular basis. There was nary a moment wherein I was outside of anyone's view or care. They certainly proved that they take breakfast seriously here.  Speaking of breakfast, I opted for one of the heavier dishes on the menu. I had a long day, and I didn't want to be distracted by pangs of hunger by the time mid-afternoon rolled around. I scheduled a last minute major medical visit, and I was already anticipating that this was going to be a long day, devoid of any fun or sustenance, even if it was my day off.  Nonetheless, my day started off well at Frank & Albert's. I chose the Blackened Steak, accompanied by Over Easy Eggs, and potatoes.   The Blackened Steak was quite juicy. I detected a hint of tartness with the sauce that enveloped it. Yet, it still was delicious and satisfying. I will note that I wasn't entirely a fan of the mushrooms that were laid on top of the steak. I am not a fan of raw mushrooms. They were covered in the tart sauce, but it didn't cover up the sooty taste of the raw mushrooms.  The eggs, on the other hand, had a marvelously prepared exterior, with a very tasteful yolk that is sure enrich one's bad cholesterol count. However, bad cholesterol is not my issue.  The red, steamed potatoes were delightfully prepared. The interior was both soft and moist. I enjoyed the crisp skins and their salty taste.  Along with the stellar service, and the great food, the view of the grounds made for a wonderful breakfast dining experience at this resort. It was a great way to open a day off that maybe wouldn't have been so great otherwise.

e28CLi3IhE7Dg0r9O22gMw.text: This review is long over due.  I love the Biltmore. The hotel is a gorgeous hotel with a history. I could easily sit at the bar or lounge all day and just look at the architecture.  I have done many stay vacations here but as a local I never think to simply come and dine here. There are so many choices and great restaurants in Phoenix.   If a resort/hotel brand like the Waldorf has a restaurant onsite. (Which they are required to for their star rating) , if they are going to spend the money to keep it modern, spend the money to attract guests. Wouldn't you think In this day and age with Yelp/trip advisor and other review sites, that this type of High-Elegant resort/hotel brand would be smart to not only capture the attention of its guests and their money. Money that their guests will be naturally be spending to eat. (We all must eat) but that also the Waldorf would create a restaurant to attract the hotels neighbors and the locals who frequent the restaurants around them.   Walking into the hotel via The free Valet, walking through the hotel to Frank and Alberts. To have a non aggressive marketing sign of upcoming events in the restaurant, then to walk into a nice bar, friendly smiling reception, bartender. To be greeted and thanked for coming in by every waiter I walk by. To have the manager being charming with her staff as we approached and then also receive that same charm in her greeting is an absolute wow factor. As proud Yelp elites; We started taking names immediately!  Ken was our server. Handsome, friendly and exceptional forward thinking service.  Absolutely would return and ask for him to be our server. The manager Mina is absolutely professional and again exceptional and engaging. The hostesses were welcoming. The whole staff seem to genuinely greet us and that is nice and personalizes our experience.  The deconstructed tamale, the crushed avocado are tasty. The meatloaf, burger and steak are perfection.  The mini desserts are fun and done well.  Omg... the cheese/jalapeno bread is mouth watering.   They have beer with food tasting (local breweries)  Can't wait to try those and can't wait to bring my friends and colleagues.   Good job Biltmore. Great staff, great food in an absolutely cool historical hotel.   Two thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meatloaf
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger duh
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UOvqc_BVGjFqet3LU930yw.text: Great restaurant in the Bitmore for drinks and a bite. My wife and I came here for food before the pool and to get out of the heat. The breakfast was delicious and had good options as well as the service was fantastic and quick.   I ordered the egg white burrito and my wife got the omelet and both were filling and tasty. I recommend as a nice alternative to the coffee cafe on the property if you want to site down and eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omlet
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast buritto
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu

eb95RuxUvv-1WJQjkM2uzw.text: This meal was supposed to be our celebration meal while staying at the WA Biltmore.   Reservations set up from Ocatilla lounge with a concierge - none of her reservation notes were ever brought up.   We were seated immediately and at a nice table.  However the couple behind my wife has some pretty fresh language for a Waldorf restaurant and we almost asked to be reseated.  We aren't prudes we just don't appreciate F this and F that at a nice restaurant, save that for your local bar.     Our wine order took a long time as my Pinot had been put in a normal fridge and was 35 degrees.  They didn't want to serve it but also didn't want to replace it, they wanted me to wait for it to warm up.   Crazy right?  Wait for wine?  Things got better the food was very good.  My wife's steak was spot on for temp and vey tender.  Balsamic glaze was interesting.  I didn't like it but my wife was trying to figure out how to replicate it at home.  The meatloaf was a very large portion and wasn't dry like some can be.   The fried onions on top made a nice crunch to go with the softness of the meatloaf.   Great beef flavor too.   The prices for the wine were a tad high. $25 for a 9'oz pour.   We had $100 in wine for 2 glasses each.  Yikes.   We need to learn to like the same wine.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best Caesar salad I&#39;ve had in years.   Great dressing!!
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meatloaf
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ribeye and augraten potatoes

9kr5XQTBPK2pMxmpRY-krQ.text: I was at a three conference and ate here for lunch and dinner. Excellent food, excellent service, wonderful ambiance and the weather was perfect for outdoor seating. Try the BLT tacos if you're looking for something tasty and different. Oh and the guacamole!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BLT Tacos

MYyfNdkLSbnotsb7_0nb-g.text: We ate here twice during our stay at the Biltmore, both for lunch and we left full and happy after both visits!  This is the casual restaurant on site, and offers indoor dining areas, a covered patio and outdoor patio as well, for those that like to watch kitchen action, one dining area offers stadium views of the kitchen. TV available in the dining area around the bar. So basically you can pick to suit your mood.  Seated outside where we could enjoy the weather and the view, our service was friendly, efficient and paced to match our wind-down mode. We enjoyed a glass of white and rose with the mind blowing soft pretzel and cheese dip as well as the salad and sandwich choices.   The wine list is wallet friendly and offers a variety of reds, whites and rose, and the menu has something for all.  They also serve breakfast if you prefer sit down to the cafe or room service.  Nice place!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soft pretzels and cheese fondue. OMG
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Super tasty salad
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 72 degrees and rose time

M1sCPgi6dVWXkgXR71rW6A.text: As I mentioned in my review for the resort this place is found in I am generally surprised with the lack of dining options that match the scale of the resort. Yes, this place is actually deceivingly big but I can also imagine that under the wrong circumstances it might be impossible to get in.  For a breakfast and dinner experience this was thankfully not the case either time. Breakfast was the Huevos rancheros and they were really very good. For dinner the Freshly Smashed Avocado -- GF Customize your smashed avocado and crispy corn chips with these ingredients: Pico de Gallo, Mango Pico, Chopped Bacon, Queso Fresco, Toasted Pepitas and the AZ Prime Ribeye Steak  -- GF Aged Cheddar Potato Au Gratin, Grilled Asparagus, Roasted Tomato, Red Wine Demi-Glace were surprisingly good experiences.  Overall, there are better options off site and nearby -- however, if that is too much to do Frank & Albert's is an extremely good backup plan.

RAtsuntTi-iL8H1aIqntjg.text: This is a beautiful restaurant located inside The Arizona Biltmore. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. We tried breakfast and dinner and both were excellent.  Breakfast - They serve buffet as well as A la Carte. Buffet is $28 and has an extensive choice of continental as well as hot items including omelette station.  We didn't do buffet. They also have a kids menu and my boys loved the waffles and chocolate chip pancakes. I had the Garden Egg white omelette which was cooked to perfection, all the veggies inside were so crunchy.  Happy hour - They have daily happy hour from 2-6 pm. They also do historic tours of the estate during happy hour.  Dinner - Lovely ambience for dinner, great service. If you are here during weekend, highly recommend making reservations. I tried the mushroom ravioli served over red pepper coulis and topped with balsamic reduction. Was absolutely one of the best vegetarian dishes I tried. Hubby tried grilled chicken panzanella served with vegetables, burrata mousse and balsamic jus. Kids menu has all the regular things kids like.  Wine menu is excellent and they have some great wines under $10

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kids flatbread
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kids Mac and cheese
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom ravioli

KSv5P1NfrlGaGDF5bOWLAQ.text: Love the variety!   We've eaten here a few times now, it's a solid choice!   Our most recent dining experiences were lunch and breakfast on a last minute night stay. For lunch, I ordered the hummus which not only was tasty, but beautifully displayed. My companions both ordered BLT Tacos, and loved them. We shared an order of House Fries, tasty fries covered with parmesan and herbs.   For breakfast the next day, I went simple with a bagel and fruit. Sadly, my bagel was a bit burned but the fruit perfect. One companion ordered the California Breakfast Sandwich which looked AMAZING, the other companion got the Chocolate Chip Pancakes which also looked tasty.   There are seats inside, outside, and in an enclosure. You are sure to find a table that suits your mood!

gyryCRr5mJB2JjvD7STsfw.text: This wonderful Frank Lloyd Wright inspired restaurant sits at the Arizona Biltmore hotel. Walk right in and you'll be taken into a time capsule where Frank Lloyd Wright ruled the architectural century. The floors, furniture, ceiling, menu, even down to the color temperature this place will take you back in time and make you feel like you're inside one of the FLW case study houses. Sit in the lobby, close your eyes Now on to the food- everything was lovely. The chicken sandwich was great, the fries were good but could have used another dash of salt. Tomato soup and grilled cheese were also a great choice. I'd love to come back here next time I'm visiting Arizona.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken sandwich

K-wYW6E8MCNab7wo05kHMg.text: My wife and I ate breakfast here during our "staycation" at the Biltmore. A little pricey but you're paying for the convenience of eating on location. The food was very good. I got the 3 meat omelet and my wife got the eggs Benedict. We enjoyed our meals and they had cottage cheese and others substitutes for potatoes and toast  if you want to avoid carbs. The service was also very prompt. Our stay was in July so it may have had something to do with that.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 Meat Omelet and Cottage Cheese
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict

YPFgft244JpWL5whs4jxKA.text: Just wanted to write a quick updated review on Frank & Albert's. I spoke with their GM, Aaron, to discuss our bad experience on Thanksgiving. He got back to me via email and then set up a phone call for us to chat.   He was extremely pleasant, understanding, and generous over the phone; offering to issue us a full refund for our dinner that evening. In addition to the refund, he also mentioned he would take care of us the next time we were in town so we could get the real Frank & Albert's experience.  It's never fun to have a let down of an expensive holiday dinner but when the GM calls you personally to apologize, issue a full refund, and invite you back in to see the restaurant to hopefully see it in a new light, things can turn around pretty quickly.   Thank you, Aaron! Look forward to meeting you in person and seeing what F&A's has to offer! :)

PnlsZxyl1frATprFEZVssg.text: Grabbed 2 seats at the bar for Sunday Night Football. The seasonal pumpkin porter was on point and the classic (errr, maybe traditional?!) pizza was awesome. It clearly just came out of the stone fired oven and the sauce was light and sweet. I overheard that the cheesecake was delicious but we opted out of dessert. No issues with slow service for us!

-AsVV-80SbzeGtqdA109rg.text: So-so for dinner. Very good for breakfast experience (last paragraph).  First, we had a reservation for 5pm & were seated in a back room (that was empty at the time), it felt like being seated at the kids table, or being in detention, or something weird like that.  Maybe I'd be OK if I did not have a reservation, but regardless, it would be nice of the host to mention something instead of just walking us by the main (cool kids', nicer) dining area.  This room had something I had never seen, by one of the walls there was like a server's station with soda machine and all that. Very cozy, lol.  Second, I do not how restaurants operate, I am not in that industry, but we were not very interested in the items in the menu and asked if there was a special. We were told there was probably going to be one but that is not ready until like 5:20ish... so we decided to wait. (their website says dinner starts at 5pm)  Turns out the special was salmon (that my hubby does not like), so we went back to perusing the menu. We both went for the Ribeye, which is usually my first option, and we both kind of regretted it.  I order mine rare, hubby orders his medium.  They arrive. Mine is super thin (and smaller) compared to his. Bad sign, that usually means it will be overcooked. Common sense dictates to use the thicker one for rare/medium, and thin one for well done (I have heard most people order well done in Arizona). They also are covered with a dark, sweet sauce. Not my cup of tea.  Of course, my steak was way overcooked. I waited and waited, and then had to ask someone to get our server so I could see if they could get me another one. By the time my server came back (he had checked on us right after our meals were delivered, but did not wait for us to cut into our steaks), hubby was more than half done with his meal.  Server took my plate back to get me a fresh steak.  Which, if you have read my other reviews, this is my opinion about that: "Oh, so your steak was not cooked to your liking? sorry about that, let me now punish you by taking your whole plate, steak, sides and all, so you can (as awkwardly as possible) observe your dining companions enjoy their meals while you have nothing to nibble on" (dramatization).  OK, so they offered to get me a new one... that is good, right?  In the mean time, hubby shared a bit of his steak with me... which was also overcooked, and not only that, visibly charred. Him, being less of a spoiled brat than me (or maybe because I pick up the bill, lol) said it was OK and he was going to eat it like that. I kid you not, that steak was so charred and burned that I got a bitter aftertaste in my mouth for a while. But, he did not complain, so no bad marks to the restaurant for not addressing it.  So my new steak arrives, & as I took a bite it tasted a bit funny... but I had already made a tantrum (not really, but you know what I mean)... so I just kept eating without saying anything... When half done the weird taste got worse & I did not finish my steak. Did you read that? I did not finish my steak. I do not think that had ever happened before. I may not finish a dessert, but a steak? unthinkable. Hubby was visible concerned, lol, so I had to explain. He tasted it & thoroughly agreed that something was very wrong with that steak. So we mentioned to our server, & as I got worried about getting sick or something, we asked to speak to a manager. A manager stopped by & the only thing he could think of is that they apparently smoke the steaks & that could be the reason. But we had already tasted 2 other steaks that did not have that flavor, & I kind of know what smoked meats taste like... but oh well.  Anyhow, the manager listened to my concerns & although I did not enjoy my dinner at all, at least they seemed to care & tried to address it.  So... yeah, that was not a nice experience at all. Not rushing to go back for dinner there.  However, we were staying at the Arizona Biltmore (summer rates to blame) & were not about to pay $50/person for brunch at Wright's (with this bad experience, lol)... so we ended up coming back for breakfast... & although I think the breakfast buffet is a bit overpriced for what it is... we had a way better experience. Considering that the breakfast items are I think $17+, $30/person including beverage for buffet was not that terrible & at least we checked out the options first, so no much room for surprises : P Joaquin was super friendly at the omelette station, he did a great job with our main dishes. And our server, oh my, I don't remember her name. It starts with a Z & I think has a K, if anyone knows the name please send me a note because she was awesome. We had very meaningful interactions & she was very prompt to assist us with everything we needed. Our dinner server was OK, he did try to connect but I think being on the back room was a factor because we felt a little neglected.  PS Dinner fries were great!  Next thing I am going to write letters to the editor!

JDOSmFC5HH8Xa_z4Z6gLWg.text: Ok, I don't think that this will be spot that I go to all the time, but the Happy Hour is strong to very strong.   $5 dollar bar boards. You get to pick four items. I had two sliders, a deviled egg, and a grilled cheese thingy. They were all darn good.   Sitting outside is definitely a plus. Cool vibe and a great setting.

e_keNOYdRhYeQipL5VBKHQ.text: Very good. They have wonderful food there. I had a great corned beef sandwich and Steven M was a super waiter. For dinner I had their prime rib which was a great deal for $21 with a big baked potato and broccoli and then a chocolate chip cookie for lunch, our server Zach was a very nice guy ad did a great job. Kudos to the Biltmore

Xlzn16gDH6Mm5yDHGtDJ3g.text: Bloody Mary comes with garnish of salami, pepperoncini, big shrimp, olive and a mozarella ball.  Ya, I'll take this over a celery.    Pass on the celery ceaser salad...good idea, not so good on taste.  Everything else was delicious.

hP_qR5eP3PEYUBNFDufYDQ.text: 3.5 Stars  Frank & Albert's is located inside the Arizona Biltmore.  As a result, the prices are sky high.  But it's one of the very few food options within walking distance of the hotel, so they can afford to charge a lot and still maintain their customer base.  My husband and I ate breakfast here because it was convenient (we were staying at the hotel) and we needed a quick bite to eat.  I had the breakfast wrap which unfortunately was a bit bland, and the fingerlling potatoes that were inside the wrap were a bit underdone (too firm).  It's hard to forgive screwing up such a simple thing.  However, the saving grace was my husband's french toast.  It looked very unassuming when it arrived at the table as a small-ish, rectangular loaf.  The serving size seemed a bit stingy for the price.  But my husband proclaimed it to be the best french toast he's ever had.  That's quite a compliment coming from a guy who is pretty critical of food and doesn't get especially excited about food in general.  But I had to agree that it was pretty damn good.  Even the fruit it came with was perfectly ripe and sweet.  If my wrap had been more flavorful and fully cooked, I wouldn't have minded so much that we paid $40 for breakfast for two people (and we didn't pig out).  But I think next time (if there is a next time) that I stay at the Biltmore, I'll plan to drive somewhere to get a more affordable breakfast.

WpL5adZGqGLELkYs_9tenA.text: The food was SOOO GOOD! You cannot miss out on eating at this place.  There was never a dull moment.  The drinks were GREAT TOO!

L7HOTR89uBZ-V0uc6RAF1w.text: Great food. Biltmore is a top notch resort and this restaurant lives up to the standards of Blitmore. Food was great. I had the buffet which consisted of Country Fried Chicken, Stake, Mashed Potatos, Gravy, Fruit Salad, Vegis... I mean the whole deal. It was all so tasty.   Buffet is well priced. But the menu items are a bit expensive. Food is great but I think some of the items are over priced for the size of the portion served, lol. I eat a lot, so my portions need to be bigger.  The people are nice.

3QgDR2eV4DKby8x6gzDE4Q.text: You have to walk thru the crowded bar to get to the restaurant. A jazz band was setting up to play so we got a chance to hear it during dinner. We had reservation but for a Friday nite, it wasn't really needed.   For drinks, I tried the Lavendar & Lemon martini. Frankly, I barely tasted the lavendar and didn't taste any citrus or lemon at all. Don't think I'll get that again.   I ordered the onion rings for appetizer & one order was enough for 2 to share. Prime rib was cooked perfectly. Came with baked potato and broccoli but we had to ask for sour cream for the baked potato. The Meatloaf was a little different from any meatloaf I've ever had, served on top of pinto beans and spinach. At first glance it didn't look appetizing but it was very moist and flavorful. I would've liked gravy or a sauce to make it more complete but I would order it again as it is. Pumpkin creme brulee for desert was more like pudding than the custard I expected but it was also very good.   The atmosphere was relaxed and happy. Lighting was low. We had to wait for our eyes to adjust to the candle light before we could read the menu. I heard a few people at a table near us ask for more candles so they could see the menu!   Service was awesome. We never had to wait for anything and the waiter was always available (but didn't hover) as well as friendly & informative. We never felt rushed and the waiter didn't drop the check til we asked for it. Would definitely come back again.   Prices are what you'd expect from a high-end resort restaurant with great food, excellent service and wonderful atmosphere. After all. that's what you're actually paying for when you order that $30 prime rib dinner, right?   Valet parking is free if you tell them you're eating at the restaurant.

Y_CZxm4v4Q9w_v5oP9Cbew.text: We are staying at the Arizona Biltmore and our package comes with lunch and dinner. Our certificates have allowed us to eat VERY well and not exceed our 'allowance'. The outdoor seating is great, especially near the fireplace. We would highly recommend the Tortilla Soup and the Rotisserie Chicken Salad for lunch and we enjoyed many great dinner entrees. Even thought it isn't on the menu, ask for the Falling Water drink....yum!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor seating

TKSIUWTU5j-r1N3SbBighA.text: We had great food and great drinks here twice.  The Biltmore Original is a good one.  We have visited for special occasions with a medium-sized group, and we had a great time.  The service was very good, also.

Hqe8EZblJlG9nQG9_yOVwA.text: I'd like to give 3.5 stars. It's not just "A-OK" but it's not exactly my first choice either.  We were treated to dinner here last night by boyfriend's visiting aunt and her S.O.  - The atmosphere was very nice; we sat in the room with the "Great Glass Fireplace" in the center and floor-to-ceiling windows all around, with a view of the fountain. - They offered local craft beer selections (including Nimbus, Oak Creek and Four Peaks - yay!) at a reasonable $6. - Extensive dessert menu; none of this 4 or 5 choices, this thing was a whole page by itself. - The dark chocolate brulee was (I should say is, I'm eating the leftovers right now) AMAZING. Sugar burnt perfectly, like when you toast the edge of a marshmallow, rich dark chocolate, raspberries. So good!  Negatives: - Menu was pretty limited - fine dining restaurants are usually limited, but not with a bunch of relatively boring options; their limited offerings usually  have enough interesting twists that you can find SOMETHING that jumps out at you. Not here. Fried chicken and mac and cheese and meatloaf? Odd.  - My entree (the trout) and boyfriend's (pasta with shrimp) were just OK. The trout and shrimp were cooked nicely but the flavors lacked something. Maybe more lemon on mine? It did refer to it as "braised lemon"... - Service was a little awkward - the waitress asked if she could start us off with some waters and we all said "Uh... sure?"  It wasn't the water offering, it was that it was like she was selling us on the waters instead of real drinks. She didn't seem to really know anything about the menu either - she went around the table and her description of each of our orders was that they were very good or really popular. I was amused that she was treating me as the "Alpha 'of the table - guess I was intimidating, heehee. - $6 for a domestic draft is pushing it, especially with craft beers being the same price. - Bathrooms are light years and eons away, OUTSIDE of the restaurant. Weird.

B6g5aw2B5E3pN5c-1hHSmQ.text: Food was just okay, and service was slow.  We waited for an hour, even though we could see at least three open tables the whole time we waited from the bar.  Duck-fat fries were bland.  Complimentary bread was cold and hard, but the accompanying kalamata olive aioli was great.  Prime rib was okay, but again not great.  The accompanying potatoes au-gratin were bland bland bland and gritty.  Fried chicken was also rather bland, and the accompanying mac-n-cheese was dry.  The highlight was 1/2 ounce of complimentary kalamata olive aioli with the cold bread before the meal.  Everything else was mediocre.  Bland.

eb5eBVuhx4-On9LoscQNwQ.text: If you come to Frank and Albert's, it's for the views and location, not for the food.  It felt really hip to be at the famous Arizona Biltmore, in all its Art Deco glory, but the meal we had here was overpriced and nothing to write home about.  I had a chef's salad, upon another Yelper's recommendation that it was "the best she had ever had" and was thoroughly disappointed.  It was lackluster, and seemed as though the ingredients came out of a can.  After a sub-par meal, stroll the grounds and you won't be as upset that you got a little ripped off at the restaurant.

tEeF7_lFc-3trlFhAtZ_rw.text: Frank & Albert's is the new restaurant at Arizona Biltmore.  It has a super fun comfort food menu with a twist.  Bar is really great with $2 bar bites and organic cocktails.  Outside areas are really inviting.  Worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Fish Tacos

sueuHn0YPks_JURmhbI7dA.text: Very friendly wait staff tended to our every need. Had a nice table outside by the fire for a relaxing casual dinner.  Caesar salad was excellent, as was the "famous" tortilla soup.  The Traditional Pizza with pepperoni, sausage and ham was great. Meal was so good we had a "repeat" served at the bar two nights later!

cSYR4w7LMPY3F6WG4ky5iw.text: Great looking restaurant located inside the Biltmore resort. It's their more casual restaurant compared to Wrights.  It's a great place to have a few apps or meal after sipping on too many Martinis at the Wright Bar.  The staff is pleasant and right on top of your next drink order.  The few times we've dined here we've had delicious food but their menu does change.  The have the coolest looking bread sticks that resemble wheat stalk and is always paired with lip smacking dips that are unique and robust in flavors.  We had the pork empanadas and risotto ravioli. All was super delicious.  A great place to sit back and unwind and enjoy who you're with.

qvQB9QPasyC1xCc-3g4aSg.text: Had a great prime rib dinner on friday night.  Ordered rare and it was perfect.  The service was a little slow.  We were seated quickly but it took a long time to have someone come by and get our drink order.  The table across from us came later and got drinks before we even ordered ours.

Ct_lEz2O1xFtizq0Cc_Uvw.text: Great Service, Great Food, Great Atmosphere, Just GREAT.  You must try the smoked tomato soup.  I have started trying to make this at home.  The butternut squash ravioli are superb.  The veggie pizza sublime.  And, if you want to treat yourself to dessert at the start of the meal, go for the so amazing Onion Rings.  You will come back and back for this (I did.  I live in NY and as soon as I landed in town, I got in the car and came back for an order.)  Make sure you wonder around the hotel!!  If you have the chance, sit in the back room next to the fireplace.  Perfect thing to do on a chilly January night.

COG6_D-YJn47DC0mPqaPow.text: Really Hip n Happen'n Bar.    Different & Interesting Drink List -  Lavender Infused Organic Vodka with Candied Petals?   Lemonade, Organic Vodka & Muddled Basil?   Wow, sure, I'll try that too!  (I do like them crisp and clean, so i prefer w/o any 'simple syrup' concoction they add to them all - way too sweet - but that's up to you and your taste.)  also thought the wine tasting - 3 pours of either a flight of red or white - was really cool and a good way to try wines I would not normally shell out for a ful glass or bottle.  Luved the bar bites sharing plates - totally YUM!  wow!  Duck, pork, turkey meatballs, tomotoe soup shooters, i forget what else, but i do intend to go back and try some more - they were excellent.  I did find it strange that along the bar, in the middle, they had this lower seating area, which was really weird - for wheelchairs?  it was strange looking down at people who kept sitting there.  They were introducing new menus and wine lists, so memorial wknd was super duper busy, which meant our service was not very prompt, but i can tell it was just one of those nites where it was out of the ordinary - there general standards look way above the normal, so i would like to visit again when it isn't as crazy there.

deOOm5VSmHOmCU0FTIIMtQ.text: This is a review of Happy Hour only.   First let me say, I went with a large group of about 30 people, and our waitress did an awesome job! She put everyone on their own checks, and was super efficient, so I would definitely return if only for that reason. The atmosphere is nice and the chairs are comfortable, and they even have a few booths.   The drink specials for their specialty cocktails are the best deal, they are all around $5. The Prickly Peartini is probably one of the best drinks I have ever had, it was not too sweet and not too tart, just delicious and refreshing. The reason I only give them 3 stars is the food, I just wasn't blown away. They have these appetizer boards where you pick 4 options out of a list of 8 items, and each board is $5. Sounds good right? Well, the choices sound delicious, but the portion sizes are very, very small, these boards are not meant to be shared. I selected the potato skin for one of my options, and I was expecting a standard size skin that you normally get at a restaurant, but that is not what I got. My potato skin was maybe 1/2 inch wide and 2 inches long, it was the smallest potato skin I have ever seen! It is like they used a scrap peel from a potato to make it. While it was good, but potato + cheese + bacon isn't hard to mess up, I really feel I got a bit of the shaft. I also tried the meatloaf slider (decent, but needed a sauce) the grilled cheese bite (dry bread and nonexistent cheese) and the tomato soup shooter (really smoky, I didn't even finish it).   While I think the concept is good, the appetizer boards are all looks and no substance. Some of the other people at the table ordered the Chicken Lollipops, the baked brie and the onion rings, which were also just $5 per plate and looked to be really good and better portioned. I would definitely give Frank & Albert's a try again, but I would steer clear of the appetizer boards.

tKu9ppiI6IItKqpbIQDzvw.text: Beautiful outdoor space and excellent food. I had the empanadas, while my dining companions had the fish tacos and the Cobb Salad. The fish came on the side and had to be put in to the tacos yourself--they still looked and I'm told tasted wonderfully.  I had the basil lemonade drink, which was quite tasty. The desert menu was very appealing, but we unfortunately had to dash before we could enjoy desert.

kZ1e8wFznX2JY5v4Hl30xQ.text: Enjoyed a working lunch. Devoured the crab cake BLT, tortilla soup and dessert caddy. Atmosphere and ambience were relaxed and calming. Love the open kitchen concept. Service by Lisa was top notch as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Try them all!
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Check out the crab cake BLT and tortilla soup...
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arizona Biltmore Block

2n7IhLib-EghA0toXJiG5A.text: The food here is only slightly better than Denny's, but at resort prices.  My fried buffalo chicken sandwich was not fully cooked in the middle and the fried mac & cheese app was barley warm and a little soggy.  The kitchen staff seemed irritated that I sent the chicken back - they have an open kitchen so I could see the reaction of the chef when my waitress returned the chicken.  The restaurant was not busy on the Saturday afternoon that I visited, but the hostess was MIA when my party arrived.  We waited for about five minutes before I asked a server in the dinning room to get the hostess to seat my party and the party that had arrived before us.  Really not acceptable.  Our waitress, however, was very friendly and attentive.  I'm a local, so I won't be returning to Frank & Albert's; I think the only people that eat here are those staying at the resort, convenience is really the only reason to go here.

7YM0018lRlyybXIOfCP7lQ.text: I was excited to go here for breakfast on Saturday and wish I would have spent my money somewhere else. The buffet was something I wouldn't expect from the Biltmore it was extremely disappointing. It felt like a Holiday inn buffet but they did have an omelette chef. The bacon quality was not great and it was swimming in inches of grease the fruit looked bad. For $24 it was worth about $10. For $30 make your way to the Four Seasons Scottsdale for the weekend buffet and you will be blown away double the size with great specialty items. The view alone is worth the drive. Maybe they could take a lesson from them. Service was good but the food was not.

Pa2t1hhp29n-Bo9GI11xAQ.text: Meh! For a high end hotel restaurant I was expecting a little more. Our server was OK, but not great. We sat for a while with empty glasses. If he was super busy I would understand, but he wasn't. My scallops were good and first drink was fabulous, but the margarita was too sweet. The sour in it should be switched to a house made simple syrup for a more fresh taste. What threw me for a loop was when we received our bill and an automatic 18% gratuity was added for our party of 3. Really?? I can understand policy for a party of 8 or more,  but 3 people? I was extremely offended. Do we appear to be people who don't tip well? Well, I tip minimum 20%.I have worked in the industry and appreciate people who are in the service industry. Our server missed out on some extra cash because of the automatic tip. If that is policy for every check, then I won't be back!

SA4xBEYaP3NtLGkYETkW4Q.text: 3.5 stars.  Located inside the Arizona Biltmore, this is the more casual of their two main restaurants.    My husband and I had dinner here, and were both pleased.  The green chili chicken empanadas were a bit dry, but tasty nonetheless.  The New York strip was perfectly cooked and topped with a mound of garlic butter and served with sea salt fries which were fantastic.  Bumping to 4 stars for outstanding service.  Definitely worth a trip back in better weather to enjoy their patio!

6B4hsiTAHdOF2dv1OMMGSQ.text: The crab cake Benedict and potatoes were exceptional. OJ is only ok.   We have eaten breakfast here a few times and it is generally good, if somewhat pricy - it is after all the restaurant in the Biltmore.

ggfzxgiP7zFIz2HTUg5Xrg.text: Stopped here for lunch while I was driving from Tucson to Sedona. Good food (including the tortilla soup) and service, and very pleasant atmosphere. Make sure to spend at least a few minutes before or after to wander around the hotel (the restaurant is located in the Arizona Biltmore) - it is an architectural gem.

3in4GN71vShz3TihoBpLTQ.text: My mother in law hosted my baby shower at Frank & Alberts. The atmosphere was perfect. We were given the outside area where they had two long tables set up around the fire pit. It was January so we did have the fire pit on and it was a nice touch. There were roses on the tables along with a couple of flower arrangements. It looked beautiful!  We had pre-selected a couple of menu items, but most people opted for the brunch. As far as brunches go, it was just average. There were several choices, but it was limited for the price. I did like the made to order omelet bar and fresh fruit.  I give them 4 stars because they were friendly and did such a nice job with the set up for my shower. However, if I had only gone for brunch, it would likely be more of a 3 star experience.

5AbHnogBzbrUmk28mLrDlA.text: We went the other night for dinner before fireworks.  The food tasted fine however the service was horrendous! And since we can go to so many other places in town for great food AND great service why go back!!?  The server had been there for 3 mos. (that seems like a long enuf time to get acclimated?!) He didn't listen to a word any of us said! We'd say one thing and he'd do another! Our food came out wrong & at different times! It was ridiculous!! We will not be going back!!  Surprising for a restaurant located in a world class resort to be so lousy!!  The Biltmore should be ashamed!!

_Rh8PEKMvVfv5HU7AE1qAQ.text: Ate here three times based on a Fodor's review of the tortilla soup, but found that the whole dining experience was below average at best.  3 things made it average to below average.  My order was mixed up 2 of the 3 times I dined there.  The quality of food (in particular the tortilla soup) was just okay-again only average.  Also, the service was slow, though they seemed to have ample staff.  Those are the cons that make me rate it as only 2 stars (and trust me, living in the Biltmore neighborhood the location was convenient where I wanted to love it).  What is exceptional about the restaurant were the grounds surrounding it.  The architecture and design is what you would expect from Frank Lloyd Wright-excellent with sharp lines and open design :).  Check out Taliesen in Scottsdale if you want the Frank Lloyd Wright experience!

O5CkAKxS5NQ8rchymTTFKA.text: We used to LOVE going to Frank and Albert's for dinner.  They used to have a grilled chicken, and braised braised beef ribs to die for, but alas, no more.  I ordered the Shepards Pie which was so salty it was  inedible.  My friend ordered the meatloaf. Ditto. I don't know why they removed  two simple items from their menu that were not spicy, esoteric, and delicious. I'm sorry they changed their menu.  We won't be going back.  Please note: their wait staff was as pleasant as usual.

7DaeEOsiqKTJE1yXn42giQ.text: This was not a pleasant experience. The hotel was over run with 900 hospitality event attendees filling every nook and cranny with loud conventioneers. The restaurant was noisy so we asked the hostess to seat us in a quieter spot. She took us to a table right in the middle....probably the loudest spot in there. We then asked our waitress to move us which she did. The food is expensive but that is to be expected for the Biltmore.  But it is over priced for the quality and the small portions. My crab cake BLT was $18 and was cold and greasy. The fries were the saving grace, being crisp and delicious. T. Cooks at Royal Palm or  Elements at The Sanctuary are far better hotel restaurant alternatives. I would not go back.

lkabZIPC9RBm5H6SnAsgHA.text: As a guest at the Resort we found this place to be AWESOME! The food is delicious! Happy hour bites, hamburgers,onion rings, and the mac cheese is the BOMB. We also had breakfast. They have a nice breakfast buffet, but we chose to order off the menu. Food was super fresh, and hot. We sat in the bar area, and Shane took great care of us several times. We found all the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. Highly recommended the breakfast tacos, and shredded pork eggs Benedict.

ZVXqfPBq35eDhHIxaM6B_Q.text: Seth and I stayed at The Biltmore this summer and had breakfast in Frank and ALberts every morning.  It was really good for breakfast but at the end of the day it's a safe resort menu.  Don't get me wrong because that's not a horrible thing...just predictable.   The huge plus to F&A is they source local meats and produce.  Score big for them.  Think about it for a second.  That place can actually keep a farmer employed because of the volume they order.  Because of that (and one of the friendliest staffs known to man) I give them 5 stars.    Although predictable it's really tasty.   Order the mint and pineapple smoothie!

yPmxVLHq_gvC7lHQrSrmww.text: We were staying in the area so we thought it would be nice to try the restaurant and walk around the grounds. We sat in the enclosed patio. Service was very good. I had the SW chicken salad which was outstanding.y wife had the tortilla soup which was about the best she has had. She had a side salad and after trying my salad she asked for some of the pineapple dressing which she liked. Definitely try this place even if you aren't staying at the Biltmore

6PToKUhZeKzlqFh6ePd02Q.text: The restaurant offers great food. The servers are typically top notch. We had one that disappointed me. Outside of that everything is great! My favorite is the buffet.

k2MCLVDqd4z51zEBMdVjpg.text: What a great way to spend Easter morning!  After taking part in the egg hunt on the main grounds (and BTW, they know how to do it here: Massive dumps of eggs full of goodies. More than the kids could carry. Plenty of photo ops. Parents who weren't acting out scenes from Soylent Green.) we made our way to this nicely upscale coffee shop/casual dining spot.   We were seated 30 minutes ahead of our reservation, keeping my little guy from popping a gasket. I chose the $19 breakfast buffet, and considering it included a custom-made omelette with organic ingredients--as well as juice and coffee--it was a steal.   Service was wonderful and the staff was sure to make us feel at home. Well, actually better than home because I don't have people looking after my every whim and need while at home.

Y8WwDYackUyvdLLmshmLQw.text: We stayed at the Waldorf for a conference and ended up eating at Frank and Alberts several times. First: if you have a Gluten Allergy, the place is AWESOME.  They have great gluten free bread and pizza crust.  The staff is wonderful and the food is very, very good.   You can eat inside or out which this time of the year is a nice bonus!   If you go, get Ines (pronounced E-nes) to make you a chocolate mocha!  They are as divine as her service!!!  Overall, A+!!!

F0Azu2Fd-IeuDoZRSh9vyw.text: Amazing!  We stayed at the Biltmore over Christmas with an all-inclusive package.  With this package we were able to try a large variety of items on the menu.  The staff was incredibly friendly and recognized us by the 2nd day.  The first day we started off with the smashed avocados.  Great flavor - def not boring!  We also tried the pulled pork empanadas.  Not too much flavor, but not bad either.  During our stay we tried the pizza (late night and the pie was HUGE), the Burger (awesome taste) and the chicken and goat cheese flat.  All were very well prepared and had great flavor.  So maybe the reason the cheese pizza was incredible was because it was after cocktails, but really not bad for a resort.  Definitely need to try the FF prepared in duck fat.  We tried this one and the sea salt fries.  They were both good, but the duck fat fries had just that little something extra.  We ate Christmas dinner at F&A's also.  Very good again.  The best part was the table-side smores!    Overall our experiences were wonderful!  Even though most of our meals were eaten here, there is still more on the menu I'd like to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tableside s&#39;mores
Photo of Frank & Albert's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Famous bloody mary

O4UULv63dJRZSsnBc1cCbg.text: Not only did I enjoy sitting outside for a lovely ladies business lunch at Frank & Albert's last week, but I enjoyed the best Cobb salad ever!  I'm picky about chicken and this was excellent quality and delicious rotisserie chicken they used.  The combo of the other ingredients (lettuce, tomato, egg, avocado, bacon, and black olives) along with the green goddess dressing was superb.  It was a beautiful presentation too!  My dining companions' meals looked amazing as well.  I saw the Biltmore Bistro Burger, the Grilled Fish Tacos, and the B.A.L.T. (their Tuesday Blue Plate Special).  We devoured pretty much everything on the table too...  The service was a tad on the slow side but it was also a packed restaurant.  I will have to return for breakfast, dinner, and/or happy hour too as all of their menus look outstanding.  The bar/drinks menu alone has something for everyone with economy friendly prices.  If you have not yet been to the Arizona Biltmore, this new restaurant is reason to go... and since this year marks the Biltmore's 80th Birthday, there is a ton of history in the resort as well.

tbdqMsSsyF-sivQCzfNh1Q.text: Casual ambience within the resort with a lot of options...Didn't see any vegetarian options but the chef made me a special fancy grilled cheese on request which was amazing.

8Wti9jYnCrqXfspj21iKOg.text: WOW! The Southwestern Chicken Salad is a MUST HAVE!! I stayed at the Biltmore for 7 days and managed to have this Salad 4x!! I'm not kidding you when I say I woke up craving it! My friends were laughing at me until they tasted it too and loved it! Seriously Delicious! If I ever return to Phoenix I may have to stop here just for that magical salad!

JTlRrdkwZ_BCDFVSIY7baA.text: We all enjoyed our lunch here: Cobb Salad and burgers were our choices. Good food and nice friendly staff. Beautiful setting.

maOVJyFB_bqfGiiyVQmQDw.text: I love the Biltmore; Frank & Albert's? No so much.    Dinner this past Saturday night was, in a word, disappointing.  I had previewed their menu on line and was looking forward to the pork belly entree.  Alas, when I arrived and looked at the menu, no pork belly.  The waiter was very apologetic and let me know that it had been removed - 2 months ago! Oh well, so it goes...I settled for the seafood risotto, which was pretty much a bowl of mush adorned with so so shellfish and a tough slab of whitefish.  The margaritas were the highlight of the visit.  Sunday brunch held better possibilities- the BLT was advertised as featuring not only bacon, lettuce and tomato with a tasty sounding onion marmalade, but also slices of pork belly! The presentation, including a stainless steel basket of delicious French fries, was so appetizing that I did the food porn thing and snapped a pic to share with my foodie daughter.  The bun appeared to be a delight from the oven, but unfortunately turned out to be quite stale and inedible.  When asked "who was everything" by my very sweet waitress, I pointed out the rock hard puck on my plate and let her know that while the stuffing was great, the bun was not. I overheard her report to the kitchen, but that was the end of the discussion.  Oh well, once again.  Because Wright's is not open for Sunday dinner, it was back to F&A's once again.  I enjoyed the spare ribs - obviously slowed cooked with intense and very enjoyable flavors.  One out of three ain't bad, I guess...  Make that one out of four.  I went back for breakfast this morning (I, know, I must be a glutton for punishment or just a knucklehead!) with my sister.  You are not going to believe this, but they had porky belly and scrambled eggs on the menu - pig heaven for me, right? No so quick!  The waiter looked at me funny and told us he thought they were belly-less.  This absolutely cracked up my sister (who had been at the similarly belly-less dinner Saturday night). Sure enough, he checked with the kitchen and no bellies. Whatever...  Next time I'm at the Biltmore, I'm getting off the property and finding my own bellies!

TS7nFihfNC1cfqesDomZIw.text: Frank and Al's is a nice place, it really is.  It's probably too classy in fact.  In exchange for the right to stay in the bar, Frank and Al reciprocate with prices that are ten to twenty percent too high.  I left after an hour spending close to a hundred dollars.  For that I ate nachos with chicken, three beers and two shots of high end booze.  Was it worth it? Depends.   I'll probably never go back because I live far away.  If I lived here I wouldn't go back because I tend to drink too much.  Quick summary, drunks stay away.

PCHjVON-KsSpP4sQb2wxtw.text: It's ironic that this restaurant is named after a great architectural team because Frank and Albert's suffers a fatal design flaw. The glass-enclosed dining room doesn't have any shades to block out the blinding Arizona sun. This has to be a problem that has been brought to management's attention before. I cannot believe they haven't installed anything to protect their customers' retinas.
